A summery citrus themed menu: burrata with preserved lemons; new potato, Sicilian lemon and samphire salad; and poussin roasted in a black Iranian lemon rub. Lemon meringue cake and strawberries for pudding. Beautiful, lemon-y hand painted menus by @scribbleanddaub to match our dinner. And white linen napkins specially made for the occasion from my favourite @oncemilano. Such a fun night in the very best company: thank you to everyone who came. And a special thank you to @cgconsultancy for making it happen
Colourful chaos in our kitchen today

So exciting to see this lovely feature on A Table In Venice in @countrystylemag. So many happy memories, talking about the magical time we spent as a family living in Broome WA, before we first moved to Venice
A field full of pretty blue cornflowers, as far as the eye can see. Lovely photo captured by @her_dark_materials at the @daylesfordfarm summer festival

Arent these just the most magical roses?! Ive been in the Cotswolds for the past two days enjoying the English countryside at its summer-y, rose-laden best, and teaching workshops at @daylesfordfarm. I also managed to pop into @cutterbrooksshop in Stow on the Wold: the most beautiful little store with plaster pink walls and the dreamiest collection of hand-painted plates. If youre in that part of the world, you should definitely pop by - could happily have spent all day there... Anyway, the biggest thank you to all of you who came along to say hello to me at the workshops: it was such a joy to meet you in person! And I hope you enjoyed the tiramis

Such a fun day shooting at home with @clairebrayford and @thegracetales today. Followed by tea, chat and freshly baked almond pastries (one of my all-time favourite recipes from my book: so good), curled up on the sofa
Spent the afternoon playing around in the kitchen and ended up with this: a lemon meringue cake of sorts, with layers of snowy white meringue, sharp lemon curd and whipped cream

Things that I love about June: the chorus of birds at dawn, the long light days that stretch well past supper time, the promise of the rest of summer still to come, and the peonies. Extravagant and ephemeral peonies
Summer mood with the first of the peonies and the first of the bellinis

Ciao! Im delighted to be sharing recipes from my cookbook, A Table In Venice in the latest issue of @deliciousaus... AND Im really excited to be taking over their account for the next couple of days too! Head on over there to follow along

U.K. friends! Were giving away six editions of the U.K. edition of my cookbook A Table In Venice! Please tag someone you think will love the book in the comments below and Ill be picking three names at random next Friday (8th June) to send them (and you!) a copy each. Have a wonderful and happy weekend @bloomsburycooks

Desperately hot today, so we went for a drive around town in our boat this afternoon. No other reason than to enjoy the feeling of a cool sea breeze on our faces and the pretty old buildings reflected in the water

One of the things I love most about Venice in summer is taking our little boat out to the islands in the surrounding lagoon and stopping off for lunch somewhere yummy. Today we went to Trattoria Alle Vignole, had our first spaghetti with lobster (my and Aeneas favourite) if the year, followed by tiramis and chocolate salami (kind of like a chocolate biscuit fridge cake
Happy to be home. Venice is looking beautiful in the bright summer sunshine, all the laundry out to dry and everyone out and about on their open top boats

Second picnic of the day: at sunset in the idyllic grounds at @glyndebourne with sausage rolls (and other goodies) cooked by @gill.meller. Most perfect setting and most delectable company, followed by a spectacular performance of Madam Butterfly that was so moving it had me in floods of tears round about halfway through the second act

Its always tricky to know what to pack for a picnic: ideally you want food that is best eaten cold and with your fingers. We opted for quail eggs (my favourite: so pretty and so yummy dipped in celery salt), cold asparagus dressed with a little olive oil and salt, and lots of sandwiches (pecorino and honey). For pudding: strawberries with tubs of clotted cream and a pistachio cake. All simple stuff, but none the less good for it. We had our picnic (rather hilariously) in black tie and sitting on a rug somewhere pretty in the English countryside on the way down to the opera at beautiful Glyndebourne. @farmella, @jo_rodgers and @subtlegoose
When your friends come for supper and spoil you rotten with flowers... @scribbleanddaub @carolynasome @misslisaarmstrong

Im excited to be taking over @houseandgardenuk Instagram stories today sharing my Secret Venice - head on over there to follow along! And you can find my full Secret Venice guide online at H&G, should it tickle your fancy

Preparations underway for a relaxed and summery supper: green and purple asparagus, chilled almond soup, mozzarella with celery, black olives and pine nuts and my favourite pink rhubarb with whipped cream for pudding. @carolynasome @misslisaarmstrong @scribbleanddaub

Excited to be sharing some lovely, easy recipes you can whip together with store cupboard ingredients in the @sundaytimesfood today. My particular favourites: this buttery saffron and lemon risotto, and a scrumptious spaghetti with breadcrumbs and anchovies... grab a copy if youre in the mood for some quick supper inspiration!
Delighted to be sharing my thoughts for the perfect long weekend in Venice in @timesluxx today. Just in case youre looking fo an excuse to come visit

So happy to see A Table In Venice featured on @khoollect today: head on over there to find lots of recipes including this apple, walnut and honey cake, tips on where to eat in Venice... and enter their competition to win a copy of the book. Ps London friends! Ill be at the Notting Hill @daylesfordfarm store tomorrow (Saturday) morning from 11am-1pm, signing books... please come along and say hello - would love to see you there

My go to when Im pressed for time is scrambled eggs - yellow, runny and buttery, served with anything from chunks of toasted bread, cheese, grilled asparagus, a plate or two of prosciutto and peppery salad (or all of the above if youre feeling indulgent). Something like fresh fruit with mascarpone or clotted cream for dessert, and all washed down with a bottle (or two) of something good. Cooking for friends neednt be fancy or labour intensive to feel like a special occasion

Snapped by @her_dark_materials on a blustery day in beautiful, beautiful Bath - where I was lucky enough to be yesterday for a A Table In Venice supper club at @toppingsbath. Such a special evening, with such a welcoming crowd - all of us gathered together to share our love of food. I think the loveliest thing about writing this cookbook has been the chance to meet so many of you in person! We might have been following each other along here on Instagram for a while and it has been such a joy to finally put a beautiful face to a familiar name - just as its been a joy to make new friends everywhere I have been in the past few weeks across the U.K., US and Canada. I am so touched and so honoured by all your support: thank you. Thank you for buying my book, thank you for taking the time to read it, thank you for cooking from it... I cant tell you how much it means to me. And thank you for coming along to say hello when you can - I love meeting you

Monday morning and I woke up really looking forward to the week ahead. Ill be in Bath on Wednesday (Ive never been before and very excited to visit: if you have any recommendations please do share them)... Ill be signing books at the @anthropologieeu store from 2pm and hosting a supper club at @toppingsbath that evening. Please come along and say hello - Im super excited to see you there! Xx

Focaccine alla Veneziana or Venetian sugar buns - one of my favourite breakfast recipes from A Table In Venice - will be freshly baked and on sale tomorrow morning at @violetcakeslondon, along with all sorts of other sweet Venetian treats (like miniature yogurt and fennel seed cakes and sticky apricot jam and raisin twists). Ill be at the bakery from 9.30am, signing books and indulging my sweet tooth - please come along to have a coffee, slice of cake and say hello... its going to be such a fun day
After two weeks on the road, its bliss to be home again. Spending the day unpacking, pottering in the kitchen and catching up on admin in my little study corner

This Saturday 12th May Im so excited to be spending the day at @violetcakeslondon! Ill be there from 9.30am, so please come along to say hello, have a coffee and a pastry. Well be making all sorts of goodies from A Table In Venice, including this fudgy chocolate cake with mascarpone icing, apricot jam brioche, Venetian sugar buns, polenta biscuits, and much more... would love to see you there

The past couple of weeks in America have been a wonderful whirlwind of meeting lovely readers, making new friends, catching up with old ones and eating lots of (so much!) fabulous food...but a real highlight has to have been the magnificent pink magnolias in Central Park. Ive never seen anything quite like them

New York friends! Please come celebrate the launch of A Table In Venice with me! Im super excited to be in conversation with the loveliest @cupofjo, talking about food and life in Venice. This Tuesday (8th May) at the Library of Distilled Spirits (80 East 13th St), 5.30-7.30pm. And Ill be signing books after. Please rsvp by following the link in my profile. Cant wait to see you there

Excited to be sharing the recipe for almond paste croissants (probably my favourite breakfast treat) from A Table In Venice in todays @metronewspaper - if youre in London pick up a copy! Thank you @kodomoluxtravel for the lovely feature

Long and blissfully lazy Sunday lunch with @davidprior and @anthonysantospirito at @viacarota. Arancini, bagna cauda, grilled octopus, creamy burrata and shaved fennel salad. Pannacotta, tiramis and bomboloni for dessert: just about the only thing on the menu that we didnt try was this crostata... but now Im thinking that perhaps we should have
So excited to be sharing our family home in Venice in @youmagsocial today! Thank you @nicole_m_gray for the beautiful feature. [photo by Colin Dutton]

New York friends! Im going to be at the beautiful bookstore, Kitchen Arts and Letters, tomorrow (Saturday 28th April) at 2pm. Ill be signing copies of A Table In Venice - please come and say hello...would love to see you there! Xx @kalnyc

New York friends! Ill be in NYC on Friday evening hosting a cooking and food styling class at @eatalyflatiron. Well be making recipes from A Table In Venice, including this salt baked sea bass... would love for you to come along! There are still a few tickets left: to book your spot follow the link in my profile
Sunday baking: nespole tarte tatin dripping in buttery caramel and pistachios

Ive got plans for a lazy and blissfully relaxing weekend after a whirlwind of a week. Today its tea, kiefer (almond paste pastries) and a favourite book in bed for most of the morning, then lunch somewhere sunny with my boys

The table for a very special lunch in the garden at @sohofarmhouse today celebrating the launch of A Table In Venice. We cooked recipes from the book: scallops on the shell with breadcrumb and pistachio gratin; roast duck legs with plums and fennel gratin; and tiramis to finish the meal off. Thank you @sohohouse @gerard_molloy and @clerkenwellboyec1 for a beautiful day

Thank you @olivemagazine for the gorgeous feature of A Table In Venice in this months issue. So thrilled to be sharing some of my top Venice tips and this recipe for linguine with asparagus and prosecco

A Venetian breakfast at @petershamnurseries Covent Garden this morning to celebrate my cookbook A Table in Venice. The biggest thank you to everyone who came and made it so special - and thank you to @petershamnurseries for hosting us in your beautiful shop

Catching up on some much overdue correspondence, writing and general life admin before flying to NYC today. Hoping for a little Spring sunshine and lots of bagels; excited for the @cherrybombemag Jubilee this weekend (Ill be there on Saturday signing copies of A Table In Venice), and looking forward to catching up with friends
Thank you @leah.hyslop for the loveliest feature on A Table In Venice in this months Sainsburys Magazine. It was such a fun interview, and Im so excited to be a part of this special anniversary issue

Rushing around town this morning, running errands (at the Rialto Market) and going for meetings (something exciting at the @aman_venice), but still stopped for a moment to enjoy the view from this quiet bridge. The soft pinks and the deep green water: Venice never ceases to take my breath away

New York friends! Ill be at @eatalyflatiron on the 27th April hosting a cookery workshop. Well be making (and tasting) some of my favourite dishes from A Table In Venice, including these ricotta and lemon ravioli... Would love for you to come along... please head over to the Eataly website to book tickets. Excited to see you there! Xx
Thank you @homesandgardensuk for the lovely feature on A Table In Venice. Such a lovely start to today (with tea and freshly baked brioche

Im incredibly excited to be celebrating the launch of my cookbook, A Table In Venice, at one of my favourite shops in London: Anthropologie on Regent Street! Please join me there on the 24th April at 6.30pm. Ill be talking to the loveliest @thechicshopper about Venetian food and how blogs turn into books; and there will be aperitivi and small bites from the book. Please RSVP to community@anthropologie.eu if you fancy coming... Really hope to see you there! @anthropologieeu
Glorious sunshine today: bright and airy, and even warm enough for gelato. Love that excited feeling that comes with these first few days of Spring

London friends, please join me for an aperitivo and a few Venetian cicheti next Wednesday (11th April) from 6-8pm at the @nottinghillbookshop (the shop from the movie!). Ill be signing copies of A Table In Venice and would absolutely love to see you there

When youve been eating chocolate all weekend and decide to just keep on going... with a slice (or two) of @nigellalawsons chocolate hazelnut cake (from one of my all-time favourite cookbooks How To Be A Domestic Goddess
Im delighted to be chatting to @foodgillysmith about food and life in Venice on this months @deliciousmag podcast. Head on over there for tips on what and where to eat and much more
Easter weekend mood and shades of spring

Wishing you a very happy Easter! Hope youve had a wonderful and spoiling day with your loved ones. And the biggest thank you for all the incredible support and sweet comments about my book - I cant tell you how much it means to me.
Delighted to be chatting about interiors with @twighutchinson and sharing my recipe for almond paste croissants on @minford_journal today. A perfect treat for Easter Sunday breakfast

Still reeling from last nights dinner at home in London to celebrate the launch of my book. So touched by the support of all my friends and everyone who came. Thank you! Stunning hand painted menus by @scribbleanddaub, heavenly prosecco from my dear friends @bisolprosecco and perfect pink linens from @oncemilano

Waking up to almond biscotti leftover poached amaretto peaches for breakfast... and my book comes out in the U.K. today! Thank you so much to all of you who have already preordered copies - they should be winging their way to you right now. Your support means the world to me - and I cant wait to see what you cook @bloomsburycooks
Pink flowers for tonight. One of two dinners with friends to celebrate the launch of my cookbook tomorrow
I still cant quite believe that my cookbook comes out tomorrow! Im very excited to share this little video from Venice with you [video by @connorimacleod] @bloomsburycooks

US and Canadian friends, were giving away six copies of the US edition of my new cookbook, A Table in Venice! Please tag someone who you think will love the book in the comments below - Ill be picking three names at random next Monday (2nd April) to send them (and you) a copy of the book! Xx @clarksonpotter @appetite_randomhouse
A lazy Sunday morning spent pottering in the kitchen.
Supper is still roasting in the oven. But dessert is ready: Genoese sponge filled with vanilla custard cream and topped with soft Italian meringue
Im delighted to be talking to the loveliest @juliahengel about food, life and much in between on her beautiful blog today. Thank you for having me, Julia! Xx

Its my birthday and I woke up to a flurry of flowers, tissue paper, presents, sweet messages and beautiful cards (thank you @scribbleanddaub). Feeling so spoiled and loved - cant think of a better birthday

Im so excited and it still doesnt feel quite real... but my book is published today in the US and Canada! The biggest THANK YOU to all of you who have pre-ordered: I am so happy to think of the book sitting on your kitchen shelf and I hope that you love it! I cant wait to see what you cook from it... please tag with so I can find your posts! @clarksonpotter @appetite_randomhouse

Londoners! Im so excited to be hosting a pop up with @peytonandbyrne at their beautiful National Gallery Caf on the 19th April: please join me for an intimate dinner of Venetian dishes from my book (scallops with pistachio gratin, fried artichoke hearts, tagliolini with saffron and zucchine, burnt sugar amaretto cake, and more...), fun times and a lovely talk about all things Venice and food. You can buy tickets via the link in the @peytonandbyrne profile. So excited to see you there @oliverpeyton
Best start to a Sunday: rhubarb jam on hot buttered toast and this lovely feature of my cookbook, A Table in Venice, in todays @thestmagazine. Thank you @sundaytimesfood
Saturday chaos and the promise of Spring in the kitchen

Baking a cherry tomato tarte tatin from @marte_marie_forsbergs stunning cookbook, The Cottage Kitchen, for supper tonight. To eat with a lentil salad, peppers slow cooked alla Veneziana and topped with flaked almonds, and chocolate custard with amaretto biscuits for dessert

Im taking over the @sundaytimesfood feed today, sharing some of my favourite spots and eats in Venice. Would love for you to follow along! And pick up a copy of the paper this Sunday for a sneak peek at some of the recipes from my new cookbook, A Table In Venice! @thestmagazine
Thank you @bloomsburycooks for the most beautiful and sweet scented flowers
Always a trusty favourite: prosciutto, pear and Gorgonzola cheese pie. Find the recipe in the archives on my blog
Yogurt and candied peel cake with a generous dollop of pistachio butter: when one slice isnt enough and you go back for more... @foodgillysmith

Thank you @sundaytimesfood for featuring my new cookbook A Table In Venice today! A sneak peek at some of my favourite recipes from the book, including this apple, walnut & honey cake, and a very indulgent orange & chocolate ricotta breakfast cake
Happy Mothers Day to all the beautiful mammas out there - and to my own wonderful mamma @romilly_mca who I love so much! Xx
Pick up a copy of the @thestmagazine this weekend for a sneak peek of some of the recipes from my book, A Table In Venice. Im so excited to share these with you! Xx @sundaytimesfood

Marias famous tiramis: the very first first thing I ever cooked for my husband (long before he became my husband...) and possibly my favourite recipe in my new cookbook, A Table In Venice! Ill be sharing the recipe and showing you how to make it tomorrow - join me on the @sundaytimesfood Facebook Live page at 11am (UK time)... and enter to win a signed copy of my book
After the rain... and before the sun came bursting out

Im so excited to be in Oxford on the 19th March to speak at the Literary Festival. Ill be joining @sabrinaghayour and @jose_pizarro to talk about food and how it can define a sense of place. And signing a few early copies of my book! Would love for you to come along... You can buy tickets through the link in my profile... so hope to see you there

Sunday lunch ending on a sweet high. Poached rhubarb, whipped cream and meringues - and a chocolate and lemon zest caprese cake. @violetcakeslondon @andreabertolini1 @alessandra.broglio @aleka_l @tommystadlen
Some early morning baking. Then pancakes smothered in pistachio butter and almond pastries (still warm from the oven) for breakfast

What a lovely surprise to find out that my book A Table In Venice has been chosen by @amazon as one of the best cookbooks of the month! Im so excited for you to see it, I cant tell you! And less than three weeks to go now until publication... @clarksonpotter

Standing on top of the world. I came across this snap from this time last year almost to the day. I cant believe how quickly Aeneas is growing up, though am happy to report that he loves climbing all over fine Venetian architecture as much as ever
Chocolate chestnut cake fresh out of the oven and ready to be smothered in mascarpone buttercream icing
Treating myself to a slice of torta alla meringa: four layers of deliciously soft Genoese sponge filled with whipped cream and then topped with soft meringue

My cookbook, A Table In Venice, has been shortlisted for the Jane Grigson Trust Award. Im over the moon! And wishing the biggest congratulations to fellow shortlistees @mymoroccanfood and @angela_clutton on their brilliant books - I cannot wait to read them

Sunday lunch today: @anthonysantospirito roasted a whole porchetta on the bbq and nearly set fire to the house. But it tasted delicious, with charred crackling and roasted apples. Then lemon roasted potatoes, a radicchio di Verona salad and romanesco drenched in olive oil on the side

Im excited to be taking over the @cntraveler stories today. Would love for you to follow along: Ill be sharing some of my favourite corners and hidden spots in Venice (photo snapped by @gilchristanna4)
This has become one of my favourite puddings. A pavlova of sorts: chewy white meringue base, a layer of thick whipped cream, then topped with pink rhubarb roasted in sugar

The very first advance copy of the UK edition of my cookbook, A Table in Venice, has arrived! I cant stop looking at it and still cant quite believe that its only a little more than a month to go before it will be in stores... ps sneak peeks inside on my stories. @bloomsburycooks
For the two loves in my life (the big one and the little one), beautifully hand painted cards by @scribbleanddaub. Happy Valentines Day! Xx

Love this photo of @twighutchinson and I, having fun in the kitchen and making sweet almond-paste breakfast pastries. Thank you @sarahmaingotphotography. I cant wait to see the rest of the feature on @minford_journal next month.
When you get up from the dining table after the most heavenly, lazy lunch...and realise that its well past 9 oclock at night. Time flies when youre having fun with friends
A burst of sunshine and a spot of afternoon tea on our kitchen table today. Hope your weekend is off to a lovely start too
We had a few pears in red wine syrup leftover from the weekend, so I treated myself for afternoon tea. With the last of the chocolate dipped meringues
When friends come for lunch and bring you snowdrops. Thank you dearest @delilahkhomo! Xx

Cosy Sunday lunch with wonderful friends today. Roast beef, crisp puntarella salad smothered in anchovy and lemon dressing, and heaps of tender roasted pumpkin. Pears baked in red wine and chocolate meringues for desert. @pipmccormac @james_rich @farmella @delilahkhomo

Comfort baking at home this afternoon, since its bitterly cold and rainy outside. Im making Elizabeth Davids pears baked in red wine - a recipe I havent made in a while, and I had forgotten how wonderfully sweet they make the kitchen smell
That Friday feeling. Hope your weekend is off to a lovely start too! Xx
Flourless (and utterly decadent) chocolate cake with mascarpone buttercream icing for a very special dinner at home with @bloomsburycooks to preview a few of my favourite recipes from my cookbook

Up bright and early this morning, baking meringues for a very special dinner at home tonight to preview a few recipes from my cookbook before its release in a few weeks time. On the menu: pumpkin soup with amaretti biscuits; pheasant and radicchio lasagne; and a devilishly rich chocolate cake with mascarpone icing. @bloomsburycooks
Pretty pink tulips cheering up my day
Home for a fleeting visit. Rushing around town, catching up with friends, running errands and loving how deliciously peaceful the city feels at this time of the year

Thank you @scribbleanddaub for creating these beautiful invitations specially for me. Each one is like a small work of art: hand drawn and painted with details of my favourite plates. Enjoying my jasmine tea and pastry for breakfast, while I stick the stamps to the envelopes; not sure I can quite bring myself to post them though...theyre just too pretty

Im so excited to finally share this with you. Here it is: the UK cover for A Table In Venice. Hot off the press, with a few final flourishes that still need to be added... but I love the rough linen finish and the pink (!) rose gold spine. In other exciting news... the book comes out on the 22nd March, my birthday!! @bloomsburycooks
Few things in life so spoiling as waking up to the sweet scent of mimosa
All tucked up and wishing you sweet dreams!
Milky coffe and a slice of yesterdays apple and amaretti cake for breakfast. Then heading off to visit friends friends in the countryside
Pink flowers cheering me up on a cold winters day

A very special delivery just arrived in the post from the US: the first copy of my cookbook! I cant quite believe it... Celebrating with pizza, prosecco and much dancing around the kitchen @clarksonpotter

Spoiling Sunday lunch cooked for us by @anthonysantospirito. Buttery roast chicken with preserved lemons (THE most heavenly @ottolenghi recipe); lemon and sage roasted potatoes; and pink radish and parsley salad with peppery mustard dressing
Cozy Saturday at home, hiding from the bitter cold outside
Feels like the weekend is off to a good start with second helpings of sweet grape and olive oil cake
Pondering what to cook: am thinking baked apples filled with amaretto biscuits? Or maybe an apple crumble

For most of the past year, Ive been tucked away in the kitchen: cooking, recipe testing and writing, working on my first book, A Table In Venice. I have dreamed of writing a cookbook for as long as I can remember, so Im beyond excited that this is the year I get to share it with you! In a few months the book will be on shelves in bookstores...AND its already available to pre-order on Amazon). I still cant quite believe it
All bundled up and heading out for our morning stroll and hot chocolate. Wishing you the happiest Christmas and all the joy in the world
Every year I bake Christmas cakes to give as presents to friends and loved ones. Its come to be a family tradition and one of the things I love most about this holiday season

The biggest THANK YOU to @stella_telegraph and @amzbryant for including me in your round up of 50 trend-setting women to follow. What a magical Christmas treat and what an honour to be in the company of such wonderfully inspiring women!
Rushing around town doing last minute Christmas shopping today; but couldnt not stop for a few moments to enjoy the magical views from the top of the Accademia bridge
Home for the holidays. Best feeling in the world
Christmas baking underway: fourteen Christmas fruit cakes baked, topped with marzipan and decorated with glac fruits. The kitchen smells like cinnamon, ginger, spice and all things nice
A chill in the air and Londons shop windows looking all magical and festive. @nikkitibbleswildatheart
The most perfect hostess gift ever from @fionaleahydesign: a loaf of monogrammed sourdough, that literally has my name on it (and which I greedily devoured with eggs for breakfast this morning
Panettone cake layered with mascarpone and almond buttercream icing for a very festive dinner with @cultofg @prior @benpentreath @mccormickcharlie @bellinitravel and @rumatkinson

And supper last night finished with a chocolate and sugared chestnut meringue cake... Thank you @maria.kastani @zoemanzi @fionaleahydesign @carolynasome @paulafitzherbert for your wonderful company. Supper with you felt like the start of the holidays
Throwback to a sunny day on the sleepy island of Torcello. Thank you @suitcase and @delilahkhomo for including me in your beautiful feature on the Venetian lagoon

When your living room walls are covered floor to ceiling with pictures from your cookbook. I still cant quite believe that in a few months the book will be out and on bookshelves: I cant wait for you to see it

A little early morning baking before my flight to NYC: praline meringues with a little orange zest and a hint of cinnamon. One of my most favourite recipes from @ottolenghi and @helen_goh_bakes's beautiful book 'Sweet'. I can't tell you how good these are
Filling the house with snowy white roses. Best start to the week

So much fun celebrating Thanksgiving with friends today (even if technically a few days late). Roast birds with apple, sage & chestnut stuffing (everything tastes better with stuffing), creamy mashed potato, sweet potato casserole, red chicory salad and white bread rolls still warm from the oven. Pumpkin meringue pie and white chocolate pecan pie for dessert (recipes from @marthastewart and now firm favourites of mine). Just wishing Thanksgiving came round more often than once a year @marte_marie_forsberg @theo_maxfield @jo_rodgers @subtlegoose @michaellynas @markpotton

Beautiful table, scrumptious food and fabulously flamboyant cocktails at @annabarnettcooks' bottomless brunch in support of @shelterboxuk. What a magical feast! Anna is hosting a few more brunches before Christmas, so if you're in London and fancy a treat, definitely book tickets now (link in @annabarnettcooks' profile

Ciao Venezia! En route to London for a few days, and then flying on to New York. American friends, do you have any tips on where we should eat, shop and play while we're in town? And anything we absolutely must not miss?!

Shooting something exciting in the kitchen today with @connorimacleod and @gilchristanna4. It's not a holiday today in Italy, but I want to wish all my American friends the very happiest Thanksgiving; and I'm looking forward to celebrating properly with a few friends (and lots of pie) this weekend
Showing @connorimacleod round the Rialto fish, fruit and veg market this morning. No matter how many times I shop there, it somehow always feels enchanting

These are two of my favourite side dishes to serve with pretty much anything from roast duck to shepherd's pie: Vichy carrots (cooked with honey, sherry vinegar and thyme) and fennel slowly roasted in orange juice and honey. Both recipes are from the @buvettenyc cookbook and both are completely sublime

Memories from glorious India: here exploring the breathtaking 13th century ruins of the abandoned city of Mandu - without a single soul in sight. My dear friend @davidprior organised the ultimate culinary tour of India last Spring and I was lucky enough to travel long with him and the fabulous crowd of friends he had gathered together from across the world. I've written all about our travels - the candlelit banquets, the boat rides down the Ganges and the rainbow-hued Jaipur flower markets - in the current issue of @cntraveler with stunning photography by @gentlandhyers. Find the link to the story in my profile and follow @prior.knowledge for more wildly wonderful India travel.

Working from bed with a pot of jasmine tea. Going over the final proofs for the UK edition of A Table In Venice: it feels slightly unreal (and unbelievably exciting) to see something I've been thinking about and working on for so long come together on paper. @bloomsburycooks @rumatkinson @lisapendreigh

Shades of Autumn in the kitchen. Thinking of poaching the pears in red wine. Any thoughts on what to do with the pomegranates? I usually just tear them open and strew the seeds over burrata cheese with a little olive oil and a dash of salt, but feeling in the mood for something a little different
Meringue, chocolate and sugared chestnut cake to celebrate two very special friends and the wonderfully happy news of their engagement. @stellapowelljones
Cold poussin with lots of mustard, Vichy carrots and a slice of chocolate chestnut cake for lunch. Leftovers from last night's super fun supper with @serenaguen @melissa.hemsley @lc and @paigetcohen

Lunch at @lhotelmarrakech, a haven of luxurious peace among the bustle of the Medina. Roasted spiced cauliflower with green olives, flatbreads, chicken, saffron rice and pears poached in cinnamon syrup for dessert
Wading through a sea of deliciously scented roses. What heaven @anthonysantospirito
Picture perfect corner for a glass or two of Moroccan mint tea @delilahkhomo
Glorious lunch in Marrakech, looking out over the city's dusty rose-coloured rooftops
Happy birthday to my (not so baby anymore) boy! Still can't quite believe he's five years old... how did that happen @anthonysantospirito
Aperitivo time: saffron rice arancini with an Aperol spritz
Beautiful artichokes at the Rialto market this morning. Cooking them my favourite way for supper tonight: just the hearts in a pan with a little parsley, stock and white wine
Monday morning in Venice
The last of the figs

The loveliest Sunday lunch with @frankieangelini and @tfwwright: penne with baby tomatoes and 'nduja; followed by roast pork loin (lots of crackling), romanesco, honey roasted persimmons and chargrilled radicchio
Sunday morning baking: three tiers of meringue with whipped cream, shavings of dark chocolate and heaps of sugared chestnuts

Cooking for friends tonight. Have started with pudding, my favourite part of any meal: chocolate and mascarpone tart with red currants and maple roast plums from a recipe in @nigellalawson 's latest book, 'At My Table'. I ate a few of the plums straight from the roasting and they're bliss

Autumn colours in our bedroom. I love how beautiful the fruit is at this time of year: I've dotted bowls of pears and apples round the house for decoration. Once the fruit's almost past its best, I can turn it into crumble and pie
Lunch in the garden: chilled almond soup, and a carpaccio of figs with fresh rosemary and a drizzle of honey. So simple, but my favourite kind of food to eat
Strictly speaking it's Autumn; but the skies are clear blue, the sun is shining bright and it still feels like summer. Almost anyhow
Venetian views on the way to the market this morning
Filling the house with pretty pink flowers

Desk day today. Writing and catching up on some long overdue correspondence. I'm still reeling from all your sweet comments about my book: THANK YOU. I was so excited to share the news with you - but have been completely overwhelmed by your generous words and wonderfully kind support. Thank you, thank you, thank you! Xx

I'm so excited to share some very special news with you: I've written a cookbook! It's called 'A Table In Venice' and it's a collection of my most treasured recipes from home. A celebration of the kind of food I love most: simple, colourful, comforting, nostalgic - the kind of Venetian home cooking you won't find in restaurants or hotels, but that is the soul of life in Venice. This book has been such a joy to write and a true labour of love: I've been working on it for the past two years and I can't wait for you to see it! It will be published by @bloomsburycooks in the U.K. and @clarksonpotter in the U.S. in Spring 2018, with editions in Canada and Australia also planned for next year. And it's already available to pre-order on Amazon now (can you believe it

A few tricks I use for lifting a bunch of plain supermarket roses: cut the stems short and arrange them loosely in jugs and jars; prise the petals open a little to give them that garden rose feel; then add a few sprigs of dried lavender to the arrangement for a little something extra.

A slice (or two) of prosciutto, gorgonzola and pear pie for lunch today. Eaten in a hurry, but very much enjoyed none the less. I love this recipe: it makes for the best leftovers. You can find it (recently improved and updated) in the 'Autumn' archives of my blog (link in profile
When your friends come for lunch and bring you pretty pink roses. Thank you @stellapowelljones for spoiling me.

New recipe on the blog! Orecchiette with fresh pesto, broccoli and green beans. My go-to for last minute supper plans - perhaps with a fennel and Parmesan salad, and a good pudding to round the meal off. Find the link in my profile. Buon appetito

'Uva Fragola' is a strawberry flavoured grape that (I think - help?!) translates in English as 'concord grape'. So good: mostly I eat them as is, or drink their dessert wine 'fragolino' (which is also strawberry flavoured); but I tried baking the grapes into a plain olive oil cake along with a few fennel seeds and a little soft brown sugar and I'm rather taken with the results

Roast chicken for Sunday lunch (with a few red onions and a bunch of grapes roasted in the tray with the chicken) today. One of my favourite things to cook because you pretty much just rub it down in salt (and a little lemon zest) pop it in the oven and you're done; and one of my favourite things to eat: because roast chicken somehow is and always will be comfort food. Chocolate chestnut pie for pudding
Getting in the mood for the weekend. And pondering what to cook
Gnocchi with butter and sage. Cozy food for a chilly night
Venice from up on high

Cicheti lunch, sitting at the bar with @fionaoscarah. Pan fried artichoke hearts, breadcrumbed sardine fillets, grilled polenta and zucchine flowers cooked in olive oil: my favourite kind of food and the loveliest company

Not the grandest corner in Venice, but surely one of the prettiest. I've been rediscovering parts of the city I had long forgotten about this summer - walking off the beaten track with Joe G. Links 'Venice For Pleasure' as my guide. The book was first published in 1966 but still every bit as relevant today
Aeneas and Eglantine making friends on the water. Such a treat to share Venice at sunset with @cecilemoli and her beautiful girls. @anthonysantospirito

The prettiest view from the water. Spent most of today exploring the lagoon with @farmella and @anthonysantospirito in our little boat - relishing the last of the precious summer sunshine. Then stopped off for lunch and gorged ourselves on fried seafood and zabaione meringue cake

Sunday lunch at our favourite Summer spot. Picnic benches, paper tablecloths, pan fried vegetables drenched in olive oil and heavenly, buttery lobster spaghetti. Too much tiramis (is there such a thing?!) for dessert
When all you can see ahead are clear blue summer skies
A late lunch in the garden, under the dappled shade of our fig tree. There's something about eating outdoors that makes even the simplest of meals taste memorable
Fig season is properly underway. I'm devouring them by the kilo: just as is or with a plate of salty prosciutto; over yogurt for breakfast, or smeared on bread with a dollop of ricotta
Happiness is the sea of white peaches at the Rialto market. Bought more than I could comfortably carry...and now we're making bellinis
Picnic lunch by a quiet canal. Zucchine and pancetta tart, artichoke hearts with olive oil and parsley (Aeneas' favourite), butter bean salad and heavenly summer fruit for dessert
At dawn. While everyone else is still in bed
End-of-holidays blues. @anthonysantospirito

Our last, glorious breakfast at La Posta Vecchia. In the sun and by the sea; tucking into brioche buns (still warm from the oven and laced with whipped cream), fresh fruit, cake and toast smothered in dark chocolate. @marielouisescio @pellicano_hotels
One last early morning dip in the sea at Sabaudia, then breakfast and we're headed on to La Posta Vecchia
Holiday breakfasts by the seaside: croissants, apricot crostata and juicy white peaches. The sound of the sea crashing through the open windows
Rush hour on the Rialto bridge
Bellinis, 'fritto misto' (crispy fried seafood) and dark chocolate ice cream at one of my favourite restaurants, looking out over the water and enjoying the sea breeze on a very hot day
Strawberry and mascarpone tart: classic, simple and blissfully summery. Find the recipe on my blog - link in my profile
The cheekiest grin @anthonysantospirito
When all you feel like eating for dinner is deep fried zucchine flowers (stuffed with melted mozzarella and salty anchovies
Shopping at the Rialto market before breakfast with @gilchristanna4. Stopped off at the coffee shop for a brioche (filled with pistachio cream) and a blissful glass of peach iced tea on our way home
'Vongole': clams sauted in white wine and heaps of parsley, with crusty bread for mopping up all the heavenly juices. Possibly my most favourite thing to eat. Ever
The view from a bridge. One of the things I love most about Venice is that magical way the city has of reflecting and shimmering in the water

New recipe on 'From My Dining Table' for a simple strawberry and mascarpone tart. This is one of my favourite go-to desserts, especially at this time of year when so much beautiful fruit is in season. Find the link in my profile - buon appetito
Glorious blue skies and sunshine today
Kitchen chaos on a Wednesday afternoon.
Monday afternoon in our kitchen. Can you go too pink

Back home in Venice for a couple of days. Enjoying the bright sunshine between thunderstorms (!) - and that serene sense of peace walking trough the quiet backstreets and along the water always seems to give me

Summer evenings and improvising supper with what we have in the fridge: quail eggs dipped in truffle salt (so good!), bread, butter, cheese. And juicy white peaches for dessert. The very best kind of fast food

The greediest and dreamiest lunch in @scribbleanddaub's beautiful rose garden. Spoiled rotten with pea and mint soup, roast beef, my favourite crispy potatoes and a concoction of meringue, cream and juicy strawberries. As if that weren't quite enough, we rounded lunch off with a pot of tea, a plate of fudge and chewy ginger biscuits (baked to perfection by @hugomacd

Celebrating my wonderful mother and her birthday with some of our dearest family friends. Relaxed supper at home: cold, thinly sliced roast beef with baby new potatoes and all manner of summery salads. Birthday cake (with candles) and ice cream (in cones) for pudding. Pink peonies and wild summer flowers everywhere. So much fun @romilly_mca! Swipe right for more from the night
Chocolate birthday cake with heaps of buttercream icing for the best Mamma I could ever wish for. Happy birthday @romilly_mca

An impromptu Sunday brunch with friends. Freshly baked brioche, yogurt and fennel seed cake, butter bread toast with Sicilian pistachio butter, eggs, sausages, yogurt, ricotta, fresh fruit and the scrummiest sweet honeycomb. Sometimes the best plans are the ones you make at the very last minute - don't you think

A rare weekend in London, with no plans and glorious sunshine. We ended up having lunch at Petersham Nurseries, in the garden among the roses and the lavender. Then went for a long stroll through Petersham Meadows, along the river Thames
That happy Friday feeling and filling the house with pretty pink peonies
Sunshine, blue skies and a happy day spent exploring the lagoon in our little wooden boat. Feels like summer has properly started. @anthonysantospirito
Making salted honey and dark chocolate chip ice cream for dessert tonight - and for the second time in three days (I can't get enough of it

Last night's dinner with friends was the best start to the week. Roast poussin, asparagus and new potatoes. Then bourbon poached peaches with salted honey ice cream for pudding. Copious quantities of prosecco to wash it all down

Thank you @lavitaforte for the most magical weekend. Orange groves and olive trees, sunshine and sea air; cannoli, seafood spaghetti, the yummiest ravioli with sweet onion I have ever tasted (anywhere!); ricotta, honey, pistachios and all round too much heavenly food. But above all the biggest treat: to spend time with you in one of the prettiest corners of Sicily. @verduraresortsicily
A fun afternoon filming in my kitchen with @bencohen1992. Followed by too many helpings of strawberry tart for tea (though incidentally - can you have too many helpings of strawberry tart
Back home, enjoying being back in my kitchen. And poaching rhubarb to eat with our pork chops tonight
When you're visiting friends in the English countryside and they spoil you by bringing you breakfast in bed
New York lunching with @susanspungen. Pretty pink salads on pretty pink plates. Followed by a very scrumptious coconut pudding, and a stroll through the Village

An early morning tea and catching up on a few bits and bobs at my desk, before I fly to New York today. I'm so looking to spending a few days in one of my most favourite. If you have any recommendations of where I should eat, shop and play while I'm in town, please do share - I would love to know! Xx
When it feels like Spring in your living room. Hope you're week is off to a sunny and happy start too

Cozy Sunday lunch with my two boys. Roast loin of pork, with chunks of apple and sweet 'nespole' roasted in butter to go with it. Somehow it feels like we've spent most of the day cooking and eating, and I've barely made it out of my pyjamas. @anthonysantospirito
Tea, sticky cardamon buns and raisin sourdough slathered in lightly salted butter with @jo_rodgers. Spoiling in every way
It was cloudy and grey this morning, and then the sun came out. Exploring the Venice art Biennale today: it's so exciting to see the city buzzing and coming to life

Yesterday's lazy lunch which lasted well past supper time. Roast rib of pork (with salty crackling - my favourite!), 'romancesco' drenched in olive oil, roasted red Calabrian onions, and white asparagus in a creamy cheese gratin. Saffron pannacotta for pudding

Thank you @haypal and @foreignsisters2007 for a beautiful lunch yesterday, and for the little posy of snow white flowers you sent me home with after. But above all, thank you for all the incredible work that you do to support Cancer Research! Xx
In the mood for Summer today. And baking rough puff pastry tarts with zucchine, mozzarella, shavings of parmesan and an extra topping of my favourite taleggio cheese
Devouring scones, clotted cream, raspberry jam, chocolate cake and Victoria sponge in the tea room with the prettiest wallpaper (hand painted and antique!) I've ever seen. @hotelendsleigh

Heavenly weekend in the English countryside. Kippers and poached eggs on buttered toast for breakfast; a long stroll through the woods; then curled up in the beautiful library at @hotelendsleigh with a pot of tea to read the Sunday papers. Wish you were here @olgapolizzi @alexpolizzimiller @charlie_peyton! Xx
When your kitchen is bursting with cherry daffodils. And it feels like Spring has properly sprung

The makings of a lazy, cosy Sunday lunch: roast chicken browning nicely in the oven; broccoli with black, salty olives and anchovies; and fresh strawberries drenched in lemon syrup with a generous dollop of vanilla ice cream on top

We took the boat out today and went out to the islands for a picnic. Simple food, the kind that travels well and you can eat with your fingers: zucchine blossom and pancetta tart, prosciutto and pecorino panini, home made iced tea (the first of the summer season!) and little jars of saffron pannacotta for dessert

Happy Easter! It's been such a treat to spend today with family and dear friends. We hunted for eggs in our garden; I pottered in the kitchen; and then we all relaxed together over lunch and a jug of blush pink bellinis. Chocolate covered 'colomba' (Easter cake), sugar topped 'focaccia Alla Veneziana' (my favourite!) and more chocolates still for pudding

Rushing around town this morning, running a few errands and shopping for the Easter weekend. Sugar topped 'colomba' (Easter cake) from the baker; duck, Italian sausage and pheasant from the butcher; langoustines from the Rialto market; asparagus, baby artichokes and zucchine blossoms from the fruit and veg stall. Then a quick spritz before lunch

Lunch outside today, under the dappled shade of the tree that grows in the middle of our campo. Clams sauted in white wine and parsley; scallops served on the shell, swimming in butter and breadcrumbs; artichoke hearts, garden peas, deep fried zucchine flowers and roasted celery. Then chocolate cake smothered with mascarpone icing to finish the meal off. Thank you @gilchristanna4 @yogajeannie @romilly_mca @c.kovesi - what a fun ladies lunch! Xx

Making fresh ricotta and lemon ravioli with lemons from the trees in our garden. Bright sunshine and a gentle breeze wafting in through the open windows. Love that the days are getting longer and warmer, and that Spring finally feels like it's here to stay

A blissful Sunday spent exploring the lagoon on our little boat. We stopped off on the sleepy little island of Torcello for lunch: roast turbot with buttery potatoes and chargrilled fennel, followed by a bowl of sugar drenched strawberries with whipped cream. After pudding, we climbed to the very top of the island's ancient bell tower: clear blue skies and water for as far as the eye could see. @anthonysantospirito
The sun is shining and it feels like Spring in our kitchen today

After a busy and wildly wonderful few days, today I just enjoyed the feeling of being at home. Catching up on reading, a little cooking and a gentle stroll through the back streets in the glorious spring sunshine

Breakfast tea and croissants in bed after dancing the night away in the glamorous bar cart on the Orient Express. Grazie bellissima @bellinitravel for the most magical two days. I can't wait for the party in Venezia tonight! More on my stories @vsoetrain
Cooking with asparagus and lemons. And enjoying that today - all sunshine and blue skies - feels like the first day of Spring proper

A cozy, blissfully relaxing Sunday lunch with @andreabertolini1, @alessandra.broglio, @s1ddn and friends. Deep fried zucchine blossoms, orecchiette with fresh pesto and broccoli; followed by roast beef and a deliciously crisp puntarella salad. Ice cream drenched in black coffee to finish it off

Our table last night, groaning with peonies, lilacs and garden roses, and all laid up for dinner with friends. Thank you @nikkitibbleswildatheart - the very best birthday present a girl could wish for! Xx

Thank you to all my beautiful friends who came to celebrate my birthday last night with bellinis and cake. Thank you @nikkitibbleswildatheart for spoiling me with the most breathtakingingly beautiful flowers for our table. And thank you @anthonysantospirito for pulling together a dream birthday party at the very last minute

Thank you darling @davidprior for the most beautiful birthday flowers. Such a spoiling surprise to find them waiting on my doorstep. And I'm beyond touched you remembered my birthday from the other side of the world

Its been far, far too long since I last wrote on the blog - and I miss it. So: new post with some lovely fresh Spring recipes, including this savoury tart with zucchine blossoms, asparagus and garden peas. You can find the link in my profile. Hope you enjoy it...and buon appetito
Flowers, presents and breakfast in bed. Can't think of a lovelier or more spoiling start to my birthday. @anthonysantospirito

Thank you @jamiemagazine and @annaberrill for the lovely feature in this month's beautiful issue! I'm delighted to be sharing my favourite hidden spots and eats in Venice. And feeling spoiled for choice with all the inspiring recipes in the magazine: particular favourites from @georgiepuddingnpie and @ottolenghi, and tantalising Parisian tips from @theboywhobakes

Very spoiling to wake up in a bedroom filled with the very sweet scent of these pretty pink flowers. Thank you @annabarnettcooks for treating me! Also, I've just started reading Louis de Bernires' 'The Dust That Falls From Dreams' - and it's bliss

Today was mostly about lunch: relaxed and cozy, enjoying being with friends. Zucchine blossom and asparagus tart; sweet garden pea, fresh mint and almond salad; @anthonysantospirito's roast with lots of crispy potatoes. Then my favourite amaretto and ricotta cake, and frozen berries smothered in white chocolate sauce for pudding. The best kind of day. @michaellynas @markpotton @annabarnettcooks @tommystadlen @aleka_l
In the mood for Spring
Kitchen chaos. And the makings of tonight's dinner
Filling the house with sunny daffodils and frivolous, pretty pink flowers. At least it feels like Spring in our kitchen, if not outside where it still seems to be raining
Chocolate birthday cake. Made with love for someone very special. @olgapolizzi

Happy to be home and back in my kitchen again. I'm cooking a very special dinner for my godmother tomorrow night. One of her favourite things to eat is artichokes, so I'm frying up a whole heap with fresh mint and parsley

One last snap from the Jaipur flower market where sweet scented marigolds were piled high and bundled up for miles. Utterly breathtaking and a sight I'm sure I'll never forget. Thank you @prior.knowledge for organising such a magical trip and thank you all @andreagentl @martinhyers @judyjudyjudystew @alicelouisewaters @playboydelmundo @suzannegoin @ladybugsph @seenlippert for being such heavenly company. I'm going to miss you! Xx

What a magical place the Rambagh Palace has been to call our home in Jaipur: endless shady marble colonnades, dashing waiters in brightly coloured turbans, croquet lawns, and peacocks strolling here there and everywhere. I feel sad to say goodbye. @davidprior @prior.knowledge
When your pink @vibivenezia slippers and your flowery sarong match the bowls of fresh rose petals dotted around the Maharani's swimming pool. All too romantic for words

Sweet Masala chai and the most buttery cardamom shortbread for breakfast this morning in my beautiful room at the Rambagh Palace @tajhotels in Jaipur. Can't think of a lovelier start to the day. @prior.knowledge

Exploring the Jaipur flower market at first light. Marigolds, jasmine and sweet scented roses for miles: thought of you @romilly_mca! Thank you @davidprior for sharing your secret and fabulous Jaipur with us. @priorknowledge

The dreamiest murals, pink porcelain plates and rose scented iced tea at Caf Palladio in Jaipur. A delightful light lunch in this heavenly, shady little spot with @andreagentl, @judyjudyjudystew, @martinhyers @alicelouisewaters, @davidprior, @ladybugsph, @suzannegoin and the rest of our merry, travelling band, after a morning spent exploring the palaces of Jaipur. I can't think of a more perfect introduction to this beautiful, pink city. @prior.knowledge

Heaps of fresh, vibrant vegetables at the market in Varanasi this morning. It's been a treat to explore this magical part of India; each and every meal we have eaten here has been utterly exquisite. Saffron scented yogurt, rich curries, the creamiest dhal and the softest flat breads dripping in butter. Thank you @davidprior for organising this unforgettable adventure! Xx ps @anthonysantospirito the eggplants made me think of you... Xx

An early morning stroll along the Ganges before breakfast. Hustling and bustling, busy stalls, music playing, monkeys climbing up the walls; people coming and going, washing, praying, going about their daily business. Then back to our hotel for a chilled saffron scented buttermilk @davidprior @prior.knowledge

Dawn on the Narmada river; and everything is clouded in the softest, most romantic pink mist. Tomorrow we fly to bustling Mumbai - exciting, but sad to leave behind this beautiful corner of India where we have been made to feel so welcome and at home. @davidprior @prior.knowledge

A carpet of snow white marigold flowers at @ahilya.fort in Maheshwar. The courtyard here is filled with pots upon pots of these delicate, sweet-scented flowers floating in water. @davidprior @prior.knowledge

Strolling through Maheshwar with @andreagentl and I'm entranced by the colours. Pink and gold; turquoise and lilac; more colours than shine in a rainbow. So excited to be here in this beautiful corner of India. @davidprior @prior.knowledge

Ooh-ing and aah-ing at the rainbow of colours on the Narmada River. Moments before we piled on to row boats to watch the sun set over the water, with cups of steaming hot sweet chai in hand and ginger snap biscuits to nibble on. What a glorious introduction to a magical country. @davidprior @prior.knowledge

Happy Valentines Day! If you're looking for inspiration on what to cook tonight, I'm sharing this recipe for coffee and walnut cake with mascarpone icing on the @marksandspencer Life & Style blog, along with other simple recipes for a cozy Valentines

Adventures in your own city in this month's @vanityfairuk! I'm delighted to be sharing a few of my own adventures from Venice, alongside William Dalrymple's tales from New Delhi and the ever stylish Victoria Mather's adventures in London
Thank you @marksandspencer and @ediblewomen for the loveliest feature this weekend! I'm delighted to be sharing a few simple recipes for a cozy Valentine's dinner on the M&S Style & Living blog

Tomorrow is the start of the Carneval here in Venice. So we had the traditional 'galani' (deep fried pastry drenched in sugar) and my favourite 'frittelle' (doughnuts made with raisins and pine nuts) for afternoon tea. And we polished off what was left of this morning's fig and mascarpone cake too

All happiness and busy-ness in the kitchen today. Whipping up potato croquettes, lemon risotto, focaccia with olives, spicy meatballs in tomato sauce, and my favourite chocolate cake with mascarpone buttercream icing
Happiness is starting the day with bread, butter, a pot of good honey, and a tray of marzipan croissants still warm from the oven. I hope you're day is off to a good start too! Xx

It's been raining cats and dogs in Venice today, but even in the very worst of weather I still think the city is beautiful. I love that you can turn a corner and happen upon the most unexpected and breathtaking of views

Focaccia, salami, cheese, 'mostarda di Cremona' (fruits in a delicious mustard-y glac syrup - a particular favourite of mine with the cheese) and bubbly prosecco. Nibbles and drinks before dinner, perched around the coffee table with 'Tu Vu Far l'Americano' playing cheerfully on the stereo in the background

When your lovely guests spoil you with so many beautiful flowers that you end up having to use empty jars as vases...I can't think of a nicer start to the weekend! Thank you @marte_marie_forsberg, @piastanchina, @lydiaforte, @dimmyx, @billaltaright, @jo_rodgers, @subtlegoose, @farmella, @maxgsilver, Thibault, Ben, Anthony and Zanna for the most fun evening

Halfway through the making of dinner: rosemary & baby tomato focaccia fresh out of the oven; fennel gratin and a pan of polenta topped with Gorgonzola cheese (for melting) ready to go in. The kitchen is chaos, but on the plus side everything smells like freshly baked bread. I'm so looking forward to dinner tonight: comfort food and friends more could a girl possibly want for

Putting the finishing touches on dessert for dinner tonight: three tiers of flourless dark chocolate cake layered with salted caramel meringue buttercream. It's my mother's old recipe - forever and always my favourite chocolate cake. @romilly_mca
When supper ends up being cake (ricotta, amaretto and burnt sugar cake), bread, butter and cheese - and you couldn't want for anything else
Today was a happy day spent writing and pottering around the kitchen. I made 'putizza', a pillowy soft bread with a hazelnut, raisin, brandy and chocolate filling

Breakfast in a hurry: yogurt, @jo_rodgers' scrumptious homemade granola, and honey-roasted rhubarb leftover from the batch I cooked for lunch on Saturday. I can't help but feel that it's a good start to the day when breakfast is pink

A lazy, blissfully relaxed Saturday lunch. Winter-y comfort food (always my favourite): confit duck shepherds pie, Vichy carrots, red chicory salad with mustard dressing and freshly baked focaccia. Zabaione meringue semifreddo and honey poached rhubarb for dessert. Best of all, though: the company of dear friends who make a simple meal feel like the most special of treats. @mayymcalil @hugomacd @michaellynas @markpotton @anthonysantospirito
Filling the house with flowers and getting ready for the weekend. Can't wait

Cooking is happily underway for tonight's dinner with friends. Two ducks (stuffed with apples, sage & a splash of brandy) roasting in the oven; lentils and kale bubbling away on the stovetop; saffron pannacotta chilling in the fridge. And I'm dipping meringues in chocolate for dessert. @anthonysantospirito
It's bitter cold outside. So I spent the afternoon baking: playing around with a recipe for sweet almond pastries, and making meringues for dinner with friends tomorrow night

Early morning happy chaos. Breakfast in what always feels like too much of a hurry. Freshly baked 'cornetti' (Aeneas' favourite) - still warm from the oven and filled with @violetcakeslondon's delicious blackberry & bay leaf jam rather than our usual apricot. @anthonysantospirito - we miss you
When you spend the day recipe-testing cakes, tarts and all manner of sweets. And then get to enjoy them all with friends for dinner... @gilchristanna4
Starting the day with freshly baked meringues and a slice of yesterday's orange blossom & almond tart (which somehow always tastes better as leftovers than when it's straight out of the oven
Finishing off the saffron pannacotta with a bar of dark salted chocolate and half a juicy pear. I love when recipe-testing turns into dinner. Better still when it turns into dessert

I've been holed up at home most of today writing - just me at my desk with a large pot of tea, a pile of books, endless scraps of paper and a notebook. But I made it out for a late afternoon stroll, to enjoy the crisp air and the last of the day's precious winter sunshine
Tonight is all about the pudding: salted chocolate 'crema' with crumbled amaretti
Double helpings of 'galettes des rois' - buttery pastry with a nice prosecco and a black coffee. A very lovely end to lunch

Fresh flowers and sweet scented herbs by my bedside - a present from loveliest @marte_marie_forsberg. I feel so spoiled and so lucky to have such a thoughtful, generous and beautiful friend (on the inside and out) who sends me flowers for no good reason other than she knows they make me happy

The past two weeks in sunny LA have been the loveliest holiday - but it's bliss to be back home again. Today was a day of peaceful pottering in my kitchen: organising the cupboards, making lists, cooking up a good minestrone soup for supper, and filling the house with flowers

Hope you've been having the loveliest and happiest of holidays. Here is a sneak peek of the blissfully peaceful view from @hoteltresanton in Cornwall where we have been spending a very cozy Christmas with family and friends. Eating far too much, long walks through the countryside and loving spending time with loved ones who we don't get to see nearly as often as we would like. Now we're headed off to Los Angeles to celebrate the new year
Jolly music, hot sweet tea, biscuits, a sea of sparkly gold ribbons and a mountain of gifts to wrap. The countdown to Christmas Day has begun

So proud of my friend @clerkenwellboyec1 for bringing to life the wonderfully inspiring @cookforsyria campaign and for creating this very special book. In it are beautiful recipes from @jamieoliver, @ottolenghi, @sami_tamimi, @ben.tish, @angelacooking, @oliahercules and countless other top chefs. All profits go towards helping children affected by the tragedy that is the crisis in Syria. It's a beautiful book to own, to keep and to cook from - and a truly special gift to give to those you love for Christmas. Please follow the link in @cookforsyria's profile to support the cause in any way you can and to buy a copy of the book now

Meringues and panettone cake for a very special Christmas lunch with some very special friends today. I love most that Christmas is an excuse to celebrate with those you love. @petra_palumbo @slovat @mayymcalil @haypal @kecalil @talarama_ @fraservirginia @stellapowelljones @flfraser @romilly_mca - thank you for a wonderful lunch! Xx
Starting the day with something sweet (a very yummy custard and pine nut tart) and a pot of hot jasmine tea
And then we tucked in... Two helpings of panettone for me. With prosecco and coffee
Christmas tunes playing merrily through the house, lights twinkling on our tree and a little festive baking: panettone layered with mascarpone and almond cream
Comfort food for this cold, winter-y weather: fennel poached in butter and milk, then roasted in the oven with heaps of Parmesan cheese and crispy breadcrumbs. Sheer indulgent bliss

Strolling through Venice in the thick fog. On our way to the coffee shop for hot chocolate, marzipan and sweet pastries. Even though I've lived here most of my life, sometimes I still can't help but stop to admire the view
Our newest member of the family, Martino, making himself at home and helping himself to a few 'cicheti' before dinner... @romilly_mca

Celebrating the start of the festive season with friends this afternoon, sitting by the Christmas tree sipping on coupes of prosecco. We had pandoro drenched in icing sugar, panettone peppered with sugared chestnuts, spoonfuls of brandy butter and then the sweetest mince pies and cheese & leek scones from @violetcakeslondon's bakery
Waking up to a gloriously sunny day and a beautiful bunch of flowers by my bedside. Thank you bella @emilyfitzroy for spoiling us with such pretty roses

Last night's table with beautiful pink and gold flowers by @aesmeflowers; Christmas tunes playing merrily in the background. For dinner we ate roast porchetta (with crispy, salty crackling), wild rice with pomegranate and butter beans, lentils cooked as I like them with fennel seeds and crispy lardons and plates of pommes dauphinois. Then panettone with brandy butter and a very rich chocolate chestnut cake layered with mascarpone icing for dessert. Many, many bottles of prosecco to wash it all down - chatting, drinking and eating until well passed our bedtime. Thank you so much to all our friends who came and for making it such a fun night
A messy kitchen is a happy kitchen - that's my new life philosophy. I'm making sweet orange blossom almond tart for the second time this week - and feeling very excited to eat it
Shopping for supplies with Aeneas. Porchetta, citrons, aubergines, salsify, bread, cheese, pasta and all manner of good things @anthonysantospirito

The loveliest, lazy lunch with @violetcakeslondon and @damianbthomas. Porchetta, creamy burrata, red onion tarte tatin and @anthonysantospirito's pasta with aubergine, fresh mint and ricotta. Then chocolate bread and butter pudding and sweet persimmons for dessert. Can't think of a more spoiling way to spend the weekend
Pottering in the kitchen today. Cooking, baking, tidying and filling the house with flowers. Getting ready for what promises to be a very cozy weekend
Back from a whirlwind trip to NYC. It feels good to be home again, playing around in the kitchen. Orange blossom almond tart for afternoon tea today....and the whole house smells like marzipan

Thank you @modaoperandi and @tatianahambro for the loveliest feature! I'm so excited to be sharing my top tips for how to create a beautiful dining table, as well my dream fashion picks, on the Moda online magazine today. You can find the link on the @modaoperandi profile should it take your fancy. Also: happy Thanksgiving! I hope you're celebrating with those you love and lots of pie!! Xx

Dinner last night was lazy and relaxed, and went on until well past midnight. My favourite kind of meal - indulgent and happy, the kind which makes cooking for friends a true pleasure and a very great privilege. Thank you @lacoquetakids, @scribbleanddaub, @carolynasome and @hugomacd (and James!) for one very fun Tuesday night! Xx

Cooking for friends tonight: shoulder of pork, slowly roasted in the oven until wonderfully tender; honey roasted persimmons; and potato gratin. Nothing fancy, but the kind of comfort food I love to eat. Mostly, though, I'm excited about dessert: dark chocolate tart with whipped mascarpone cream and sharp red currants

Red wine, pears and some very tasty cheese. Making plans for our trip to New York later this week: if you have any recommendations for where we should eat, shop and play while we're there, please share - I would so love your tips. Thank you so much! Xx

Thank you darling @violetcakeslondon for the most spoiling box of Christmas goodies! What a treat to find such a beautiful package waiting on our doorstep... I should probably have waited until Christmas to open it, but couldn't resist: we're having your heavenly mince pies, Mexican cookies and ginger molasses cake for tea today

I'm sharing my thoughts on motherhood, clutter, and eating cake for breakfast in a lovely interview on @the_early_hour today. All of which got me thinking: how do you cope with clutter?! I would so love to hear how you tackle it... Xx

Venice this morning: cold, damp, and foggy - but still beautiful. We're packing our bags and headed to London today. With a picnic of prosciutto, mozzarella and artichoke panini and freshly baked pastries from our local pasticceria to tide us over on the plane
The makings of supper: chargrilled radicchio with a smattering of ruby red pomegranate seeds; and pan fried artichoke hearts with heaps of parsley

Chocolate, tea and cake with @gilchristanna4 at Caf Florian, indulging in a long overdue catch up. Between you and I - winter's not my favourite time of year. I'm already dreading the cold and the dark, and the days which somehow always feel too short. But one thing I do look forward to is the license to drink hot chocolate at will. Other things to look forward to: reading novels by the fire, long walks in the mist, bread and butter pudding (somehow a winter thing) and Christmas

The view looking out from the market this morning. Often I'm in too much of a hurry or too busy working my way through my to-do list to stop and take notice - but I'm glad I looked up from my shopping today

I've been holed up at home writing, all of yesterday and most of today. But after lunch, I took a couple of hours to go for a stroll through the city with my Mamma. Headed nowhere in particular, enjoying the fresh air and the pretty views, chatting about everything and nothing. And then we stopped off for hot chocolate and chocolate cake. @romilly_mca
Sunday day dreaming. Catching our reflection in the water and admiring the boats. Then deep fried seafood and potatoes for lunch. @lacoquetakids
It's my favourite kind of lunch when we're all still sitting round the table as the light starts to fade and the sun goes down
Glorious sunshine and piercing blue skies today. The kind of weather that has you thinking Autumn might just be your favourite time of year after all
Thank you @luisabrimble and @the_dailys for my beautiful, wild roses. They make my heart sing every time they catch my eye

Glorious, seductive Autumn bounty spilling out of our kitchen. I'm feeling very lucky to have @luisabrimble and @the_dailys staying with us for a couple of days; but I'm feeling even more spoiled to find myself showered with flowers, fruit and all things good. Grazie, belle! Xx
Happy Birthday to the sweetest little boy a Mamma could wish for! Celebrations, toy cars and chocolate cake all round... @anthonysantospirito

Ciao Venezia! After weeks of travelling here, there and everywhere, it feels deliciously good to be home. Strolling through the quiet backstreets, drinking hot chocolate (with a hint of rum) at our local caf, and enjoying that distinct, chilly fog which comes with the start of Autumn. Extra special treat: to find @luisabrimble, @the_dailys, @emikodavies and @valerianecchio in town to enjoy all of these favourite things with me

Such a fun night last night: simple, autumnal, comfort food (roast chicken and baked Camembert cheese); the loveliest company; sitting up chatting and laughing until well past our bedtime; and an apple galette with sweet chestnut ice cream to finish it all off. @annabarnettcooks @michaellynas @markpotton @anthonysantospirito

While I was I was in sunny Australia I was honoured to be interviewed by Sophie Hansen of @locallovely. The interview is now live on the @myopenkitchen podcast - and I'm so excited to share it with you. If you don't already subscribe to @myopenkitchen, please do head over and take a peek: for anyone who loves food and the good life, it's an absolute must, and has fast become my favourite thing to listen to while I'm pottering around in the kitchen

Thank you @vogueliving and @davidprior for the loveliest feature in the September issue! Dreamy pictures by @filippobamberghi and beautiful, beautiful words by my dear friend, David - brings back the happiest memories of our days spent exploring Venice together. Xx

Wishing you a lovely and lazy weekend. I'm curled up on the sofa right now: reading Julia Child's 'My Life in France', sipping on a cup of jasmine tea and fantasising about what we should have for dinner. I hope that you're doing something equally indulgent too! Xx

Chocolate, chestnut and rosemary cake with sweet mascarpone icing. An old and trusted favourite Venetian recipe (you can find it among the archives on my blog) which I made for a very special lunch at @venetarestaurant with @ben.tish. We devoured it with spoonfuls of Ben's exquisite goats milk gelato

Food and books: two of my most favourite things. I'll be talking about the most evocative and memorable food scenes in literature - with food editor, @laurelives, and author, Damian Barr - at a very special dinner hosted by the @sundaytimesfood at the Cheltenham Literary festival tomorrow. Starts at 7.30; tickets on sale now on the @cheltfestivals website; really looking forward to it; Miss Marple's 'Death by Chocolate' chocolate cake for pudding; come say hi! Xx

I arrived back in London yesterday. And I couldn't be more excited to collaborate with @ben.tish on a special preview lunch at his latest, beautiful and Venetian inspired restaurant, @venetarestaurant which opens at the end of the month. Seafood 'crudi', prosecco in vintage silver coupes, tagliatelle with gorgonzola & pear, and perfectly cooked porcini risotto. Grazie to everyone who came, and the biggest grazie to Ben for cooking up a storm! Xx

Our last lunch together on the farm in the Blue Mountains. Sitting, chatting, eating - under the dappled shade and among the pink blossom. I can't think of a dreamier setting, or more delicious company - thank you @locallovely @luisabrimble, @artclasseswithannieherron, @photographybypip, @gillianbellcake, @sparkle_cyanide and to all our beautiful guests who travelled so far to be there with us
Enjoying all the beauty of Spring while I'm here in the Southern Hemisphere. Apples, golden fallen leaves and a brisk Autumn chill waiting for me when I get home to Europe

We woke up before dawn and strolled out to an open field to watch the pink dawn rise over the Blue Mountains (more snaps on my IG story). Huddled by a glowing bonfire and sipped on mugs of @locallovely's cardamom scented coffee; then back to the warmth of the cottage and @photographybypip's fluffy pancakes drenched in golden local honey

One long table; flickering candles; baskets of beautiful garden produce; fresh herbs scattered across the table; wine, plenty of food and the heavenly chorus of people having a good time. The kind of stuff that makes my heart sing. Thank you @locallovely, @luisabrimble, @sparkle_cyanide, @gillianbellcake and @photographybypip for an unforgettable evening! Xx
Afternoon tea looking out over the Blue Mountains, with @sparkle_cyanide's magical vanilla butter cake. The sound of parrots chirruping gently in the background. Like stepping into a fairytale

Sweet rhubarb galette, freshly baked by @locallovely, for morning tea. A very early start to the day and a beautiful drive to a local farmer to buy produce; then we gathered blossom in the garden, layed the table for dinner tonight, and baked cakes. @locallovely @luisabrimble

Drowning in a sea of pink blossom and I couldn't be happier. I'm ensconced at @locallovely's idyllic farm in the Australian Blue Mountains and getting ready for the start of our workshop with @luisabrimble. So excited to meet our guests tomorrow and to be in this magical part of the world. (Photo by the loveliest @luisabrimble
Thank you @lavitaforte for the loveliest and sweetest scented bunch of flowers - such a treat to find them waiting on our doorstep. Please come for supper again soon! Xx
I'll be cooking this fig, ricotta and honey galette in The Dish kitchen today. Tune in to watch me live at 4pm (GMT) on the @sundaytimesfood Facebook page - really hope to see you there! Xx

Feeling deliciously inspired by the last of the ripe summer fruit and the bounty of Autumn goodies that are just coming into season. So many beautiful flavours to play with and such an exciting time of year to create magic in the kitchen

I'm excited to be guest speaking at the @sundaytimesfood's literary dinner at the Cheltenham festival on Friday 14th October at 7.30pm. Chatting about literature and good food (two of my greatest passions) with @laurelives and Damian Barr - over a menu inspired by the works of Donna Leon, Virginia Woolf and Agatha Christie. Would love for you to come! Tickets for the dinner are on sale now on the @Cheltfestivals website

Heavenly dinner with @stellapowelljones, @lavitaforte, @farmella, @jo_rodgers and @subtlegoose last night. I made roasted poussin, burrata with preserved lemons & fresh thyme, and this chocolate tart (with mascarpone cream, Autumn fruits and brandied chestnuts
Shopping for flowers, fresh fruit, chocolate biscuits and other essential provisions for the weekend. Hope you have a lovely weekend too! Xx
Kitchen chaos and the beginnings of lunch

Sunday morning baking from @turshen's stunning new book, 'Small Victories'. There are so many beautiful and inspiring recipes in this book, that I almost don't know where to begin... So (after much to-ing and fro-ing): upside down plum cake (with fruit caramelised in butter and dark sugar); crispy roast chicken; and oven roasted radishes with black olives

This chocolate, olive oil and walnut cake is an old favourite. Something I bake time and time again - for breakfast, tea, when I fancy something sweet or what have you... I'm so happy to be sharing the recipe (along with other favourites - like baked peaches with saffron zabaione, and roast dorado with figs and almonds) in the September issue of @foodandwine

One of my guilty secret pleasures is reading cookbooks like novels (often when tucked up in bed before drifting off to sleep). Tasting Rome', a stunning collection of Roman recipes by @kristinagillphoto and @katieparla is utterly entrancing and has me longing for a Roman Holiday
