The fruits of a happy afternoon spent baking: peach and saffron pastries, and a yogurt cake with candied orange peel and fennel seeds
Strolling through this peaceful part of town on our way to the boatyard. Am endlessly enchanted by the pastel coloured houses and by the soft shades of their reflection in the water

Grazie @foodandwine for the lovely feature in the September issue! I'm excited to be sharing some of my favourite corners of the Venetian lagoon, as well as a few indulgent late summer recipes... Beautiful words by @giselaatlarge and stunning pictures by @simonpwatson @niloumotamed @kkrader
Picking figs and wild blackberries in the lagoon today. Enjoying the last of the summer sunshine, and some peace away from the city centre as it gets riled up for the opening of the film festival
Sweet figs and juicy white peaches for breakfast. And then again for lunch and dinner. We can't get enough of them

We spent the morning speeding around the lagoon in our little boat, feasting on a picnic of almond and glac fruit pastries. Then we stopped off at our favourite spot for a lazy seafood lunch. Such a treat to spend the day on the water, enjoying the sunshine and in the company of gorgeous friends. @anthonysantospirito @farmella

Fig and mascarpone cake - freshly baked, still deliciously warm in the middle and drenched in icing sugar - for afternoon tea. Such a more-ish cake: I couldn't resist helping myself to a second (and third) slice
Supper tossed together at the last minute. Fresh ricotta, summer fruit, spoonfuls of honey and mint from the garden. The kind of food I crave on a hot summer's evening

Fun times bumping over the waves in our little old boat today. Sunshine, sea air and a lazy lunch in the garden at my favourite restaurant on Torcello. More on my story and on the @voguesposait Instagram account which I am taking over today @anthonysantospirito
I'm excited to be taking over the @voguesposait Instagram account all day tomorrow... Would love for you to follow along and hope to see you there! Buona notte and happy Sunday! Xx

The sweetest plums for afternoon tea. Today has been one, heavenly long meal after another: pastries and chocolate eclairs at the pasticceria for breakfast; an improvised lunch of mozzarella and tomatoes in the garden. And now we're planning what to do for dinner

Fresh watermelon, slices of cantaloupe, kiwi fruit (like gold dust in Venice!) and a pot of coffee for breakfast with @clerkenwellboyec1 and his lovely family - ensconced in a shady corner of the fairytale gardens at Il Paladio on the Giudecca @thebauersvenice

There is something endlessly enchanting about this quiet, unassuming little corner - it catches my eye every time I walk past. I think it's the worn, pink plaster of the houses - and something about how the colours reflect in the water

Shopping for tonight's dinner at the fruit and veg stall in Campo Santa Maria Formosa: bags and bags of these deliciously sweet baby tomatoes to make into chilled summer soup with mascarpone and slivers of almond

The calm before the storm. Limpid blue skies this morning - the city enveloped in a soft haze of heat, like cotton wool. Then tonight, the heavens opened and the mother of all summer storms swept in to clear the air

The view, in all its dramatic glory, from the very top of Cawdor Castle. I'm Venice-bound, with a suitcase full of fudge and cashmere, leaving the Scottish Highlands behind... Thank you @petra_palumbo and @slovat for a magical and unforgettable weekend - I feel so privileged to have been a part of it! Xx
I could happily just eat fruit for supper
A late afternoon stroll to the fruit stall - on a quest for watermelon, baby golden plums, squashed Persian peaches and a punnet of juicy figs. More on my @instagram story

Summery picnic fare: roasted fennel and baby tomato tartlets with a dollop of mascarpone and deliciously buttery puff pastry. You can find the recipe in the latest issue of The Dish (out with the @sundaytimesfood today), should it take your fancy... Xx

Such a peaceful, sunny day today. Freshly baked brioche for breakfast at our local caf with Aeneas; chilled tomato gazpacho for lunch with the loveliest @annabarnettcooks. A stroll through town and now I'm curling up in our garden with a glass of iced tea and a very worn copy of Brideshead Revisited

I'm so excited to be sharing the recipe for this apricot jam and saffron 'crostata' in the @sundaytimesfood today. It has become a real favourite in our household - for picnics and afternoon tea alike

A hot summer's day and a picnic by the waterside in a quiet little corner of Venice. Fennel and baby tomato tartlets; wild rice and butter bean salad; tomatoes stuffed with breadcrumbs, pecorino cheese and garden herbs; sweet peach iced tea and a homemade 'crostata'. I'm excited to be sharing all the recipes in The Dish out with the Sunday Times this weekend. @sundaytimesfood @gilchristanna4
Watching the sun go down - sitting at our local bar, spritz in hand, a soft seaside breeze in the air and seagulls circling above

Lunch at the picnic bench we have come to know as 'our table', and under the shade of the same big, old tree we always sit by. Spaghetti, risotto and all manner of seafood - followed by tiramis, coffee and biscuits. I've been coming to this trattoria since I was a little girl - and it still holds that same, higgledy-piggledy magic for me now as it did then

Late afternoon stroll with gelato in hand (one scoop of deliciously dark chocolate and a second of creamy hazelnut - in a cone, of course). The same way we almost always go: along the waterfront, through the sleepy Castello quarter and towards the park
Lazy Sunday breakfast: sweet melon, chunks of watermelon with fresh mint from our garden, flat white peaches and freshly baked brioche filled with apricot jam (from my favourite 'pasticceria
Walking home from the Rialto market, laden down with fresh flowers and summer fruit
Thank you @joannagoddard for the loveliest feature on 'Cup Of Jo' - it is such a privilege to be a part of your beautiful blog!! Xx

The past week has been a mad rush of travel and meetings - it's heaven to be back home in sleepy Venice. And the loveliest start to today, catching up with @bliu07 and @valentinahortus over iced tea, sitting under the shade in one of the prettiest squares in Venice

I'm on fleeting visit to London (work meetings and catching up with friends). First stop: the flower stall. Because home somehow never quite feels like home until there is a vase of flowers sitting on the dining table

Spent this afternoon driving around the lagoon in our rickety little boat, then stopped off for gelato on the island of Burano. On hot days like this, there is nothing so soothing as the sea breeze, and the salt water spraying on your face as you bump over the waves

I am so excited to announce that this October I will be hosting a workshop in Australia with @luisabrimble and @locallovely. Two and a half days of cooking, recipe development, creative writing, as well as food styling and photography, set on an idyllic farm in the Blue Mountains. There are still a couple of spots left - for all the details and to book your spot please go to the 'workshops' page on @locallovely's beautiful blog. Can't wait to see you there! Xx

Watching the sun set, as all the boats gather along the Grand Canal for the Redentore festival. Probably my favourite night of the year - when Venice is swept away by a wild street party, come midnight the skies light up with fireworks, and we all feast on pan fried mussels and juicy watermelon

A heavenly and lazy lunch under the dappled shade today. Pan fried artichoke hearts, roasted garden tomatoes, deep fried stuffed zucchine flowers, crab claws, barbecued eel and tiramis with strong coffee to finish it off. A speedy boat ride home, a quick siesta and now we're getting ready for the Redentore festival and fireworks tonight. Follow along on snapchat (skyemcalpine) for snaps from the day and the party tonight. @bellinitravel @anthonysantospirito
Aeneas leading our quest for chocolate and pistachio gelato

It's always a treat to travel, but it's an even greater treat to come home. So happy to arrive back in Venice today - I couldn't think of a more magical welcome than these winding canals, bathed in bright sunshine

Just landed in Stockholm where the sun is shining wonderfully bright. Tucking into a lunch of lobster, crab, oysters, prawns, mayonnaise and very more-ish rye crisp bread before we set about exploring the city. @anthonysantospirito

Crumpled white linens and golden hues on a shoot with @davidprior. Grazie, David, it's been so much fun spending the past few days with you - and a privilege to be styled by one of the most stylish men I know!! Xx
Happy to be sharing my thoughts on summer parties chocolate cake and what inspires me on @mybabablogging today. Thank you so much for the lovely feature! Xx

Yesterday's heavenly lunch with @davidprior. Spaghetti with lobster, risotto with scampi and golden zucchine flowers, artichoke hearts drenched in parsley and olive oil, 'bovoletti' with garlic, fried sardines and more. Too much good food and too much fun
This morning I woke up to bright sunshine, the soothing sound of water and boats driving past along the canal under my bedroom window. So happy to be back home for the summer

Ruby red cold roast beef and baby potatoes that have been roasting in the oven for hours - with garlic, sea salt and fennel seeds - until impossibly and deliciously crisp. Meringues with whipped cream and strawberries for dessert
Baking more bread and making more jam tarts this afternoon. And sampling as I go along. The kitchen smells like my idea of heaven
Hypnotised by these peonies. Overblown, otherworldly and such a sweet scent - they smell like summer

The most heavenly and decadent lunch of chargrilled Galician beef and fried potatoes with @petra_palumbo at @kittyfishers today. Keeping it light for supper with a plate of white asparagus drenched in zabaione sauce
Sunday picnic in the park with bottles of chilled peach iced tea, an apricot and saffron jam tart for dessert, and lots and lots of daisy chains

Leftover birthday cake (made using @nigellalawson's recipe for spiced gingerbread, which I think tastes even more heavenly when it's a day or two old) and freshly baked madeleines (which I made using the foolproof and beautiful recipe in @violetcakeslondon's book) for afternoon tea today
Two tiers of sticky, spiced gingerbread cake layered with copious quantities of mascarpone icing to celebrate @romilly_mca's birthday. Happy birthday to the best Mamma a girl could wish for!! Xx
Shades of pink in our kitchen this afternoon. It's my favourite colour - something about it that I find endlessly seductive, and has a way of always making me smile
Thank you @youmagsocial and for the loveliest feature! Such a nice surprise to stumble upon it in my paper yesterday... @clarenolanuk @joleevers @nicole_m_gray @michaelsinclair xxx

Last night's dinner was slow roasted veal with baked plums and rosemary potatoes; freshly baked focaccia bread still warm from the oven; impossibly sweet Calabrian red onions, chargrilled on the bbq with a drizzle of oil and a dash of salt; and a tian of zucchine and finely sliced tomatoes. To finish it off white peaches with mascarpone cream and a glass of sherry - then we lingered around the dining table, chatting about everything and nothing into the early hours of the morning. Such a treat to see you @michaellynas and @markpotton! Xx
Happy Father's Day to the very best Papi! We love you to the moon and back and are so lucky to have you in our lives! @anthonysantospirito
Weekend supplies. Veal joint roasting slowly in the oven, focaccia dough proving by the stovetop. Saturday night dinner is well underway
That summer feeling tonight... Fresh flowers, sunny lemons and the first of the season's peaches for mixing up a jug of bellini
Beautiful, gleaming cherries: stoned, halved and ready for poaching with a little sugar, brandy and fresh rosemary

Making gnocchi (to @anthonysantospirito's magical recipe) for supper tonight; then frying them up with butter, fresh sage and copious quantities of parmesan. White peaches, poached in amaretto syrup and served chilled with a dollop of mascarpone, for dessert. A very lovely end to one week, and start to the next

A white chocolate sponge cake, layered with fresh black cherries and topped with mascarpone icing, for a very special little girl on a very special day. So happy to have been a part of it - thank you @lacoquetakids! Xx And thank you, @violetcakeslondon, for all your brilliant cake-making tips! Xx
The meringues were intended for tonight's dessert - but I couldn't resist and we ended up eating them for afternoon tea instead

Freshly baked yogurt cake - made with a smattering of fennel seeds, candied peel and laced with orange blossom scented icing - for afternoon tea today. It's always a treat when recipe testing turns into an impromptu meal
I'm happy to be sharing my thoughts on motherhood, love, life and food on @sweetcabane's beautiful blog today. Grazie, Emilie, for the loveliest interview! Xx

So much fun cooking with @lacoquetakids and her beautiful children yesterday. We made savoury tarts, salted honey ice cream and jugs of iced summer lemonade. Then we sat on the grass and ate it all! Thank you, Celia and @lesleycolvin for a wonderful afternoon! Xx

So excited to see my recipes and tips for easy entertaining featured in the @sundaytimesfood today! Along with some scrumptious looking cakes, salads and summery dishes from @tanyaburr, @thehappypear and @ducksoupsoho. Thank you @laurelives - it's a beautiful issue and I'm thrilled to be a part of it! Xx

A snapshot from a lazy dinner on a light summer's evening: cold roast beef with homemade mayonnaise; fennel, baby tomato and mint panzanella; broad bean, mint and pecorino salad; and a fig and whipped ricotta galette to finish it off. Find the recipes along with tips for how to throw an easy dinner party in The Dish (out with the Sunday Times) tomorrow. @sundaytimesfood

Spending this weekend in the English countryside. Breakfast this morning was eggs, from the next door farm and scrambled to creamy perfection by @jo_rodgers; toasted crumpets; salty, crisp bacon; and a large pot of tea. All very idyllic and very English and can't think of a more charming place to enjoy it, than here sitting under the rose bush

Whipped ricotta, fig and honey galette - my go-to dessert for when I'm in a hurry and want something spoiling to round off dinner. I'm so excited to be sharing this recipe (and others) in The Dish this weekend (out on Sunday with The Times)! @sundaytimesfood
Spoiling myself with a jug of pink peonies to go by my bedside. Because their season is so precious and short, and because there is something about them that is quasi-magical
Ciao Venezia! I'm headed back to London for a few days, but I'm sad to leave the blue skies and clear waters behind
Enjoying the sunshine before the skies clouded over, the heavens opened and... it rained down cats and dogs

Lazy lunch in the garden today, sitting under the dappled shade of the fig tree. Scallops cooked on the shell with crisp breadcrumbs and swimming in butter; garden peas deliciously sweet and still in their pods, a fresh tomato salad and a big bowl of juicy squashed peaches for dessert

Thank you @telegraphfood for the lovely feature today, with stories and recipes from my time in in my Venice kitchen with wonderfully talented London chef @ben.tish. Find our recipes for fresh bigoli, fish soup, and rose meringues with saffron zabaione (among other dishes) in the Saturday Telegraph Magazine today; along with some beautiful photography by @ben_quinton @nykeetatish @clerkenwellboyec1 @chefjamiethickett
Happy to be back in the kitchen. Chargrilled asparagus with pecorino cheese and fried eggs for dinner tonight. Followed by sugar poached rhubarb, with meringues and mascarpone cream

I always love an excuse to travel; and the past week in New York has been a whirlwind of dates with friends, exciting meetings, strolls through the city and eating at new (and old) favourite restaurants. That said, there is no place so sweet as home: it was a treat to see Aeneas' smiley face and a house full of flowers when I walked through the door this morning. @anthonysantospirito
Standing among a sea of sweet scented lilacs at Union Square Greenmarket. And smiling head to toe @charlotte_olympia
Enjoying a dreamy New York moment. Picnic in the park with chocolate babka and pastries from @breadsbakery (insanely good), the latest issue of @cherrybombemag and Capote's 'Breakfast at Tiffany's

Bags packed, a stack of books laid out for in-flight reading, and I'm all ready to go. Peach and saffron pastries for breakfast (still deliciously warm from the oven) before I rush to the airport and on to my flight to NYC

A long and deliciously lazy Sunday lunch. Honey and truffle glazed ribs grilled on the barbecue, fresh tomato and fennel panzanella, chargrilled asparagus, aubergine and sweet onion. Then a pile of meringues, whipped cream laced with Pedro Ximenez sherry and pastel pink rhubarb poached in sugary syrup to finish us off
A lazy start to our Sunday, with a pot of hot, sweet tea and a good book. Waiting for the toast to brown so that I can hop back in bed and enjoy it, slathered in butter and peach jam

Grazie mille @ft_howtospendit and @mariashollenbarger for the beautiful feature on my collaboration with @bellinitravel and the secrets of the Venetian lagoon! What a lovely start to the weekend... Xx

I spoiled myself with flowers this morning. They smell deliciously sweet - like the first, sun-soaked days of Summer - and are going in a little vase by my bedside so that I can enjoy them as I doze off to sleep tonight
Tonight's pudding is puff pastry galette with whipped ricotta cream, fresh figs and a drizzle of runny honey. @anthonysantospirito
Thank you @townandcountryuk for the lovely feature in your Spring issue. Grazie, grazie, grazie! Xx

Ciao Venezia! We're headed to the airport. I have meetings in London next week, as well as friends I'm long overdue to catch up with and a wedding to go to (can't wait!); then on to NYC for more of the same. But I'm looking forward to being back in Venice soon; the month of May - with its glorious long, sunny days and shimmering wisteria - is the most heavenly time of year here

Pale pink tulips for our dining table, and a lovely bunch of anemones to go in a little glass vase by my beside. The flower stall at the Rialto was bursting with Spring flowers, in all the glorious colours of the rainbow, this morning
Walking through Piazza San Marco at dawn on our way to the Rialto market before the best is gone. Not a soul to be seen, except for a few seagulls circling in the sky

Today has mostly been taken up with the business of eating and enjoying the glorious Spring weather: a lazy lunch in our garden under the shade of the leafy fig tree, followed by a leisurely stroll through the back streets with a chocolate gelato
Finishing dinner off with a cup of saffron pannacotta and some deliciously sweet strawberries

Lazy lunch of chargrilled vegetables, creamy burrata cheese and plate upon plate of deep fried zucchine flowers with @anthonysantospirito. Sipping on iced tea, watching the boats drive past along the Grand Canal, and chatting about everything and nothing
Late afternoon stroll along the waterfront, eating gelato and enjoying the sunshine. Walked past this doorway and it took my breath away

One of my favourite spots to work: under the colonnades in Piazza San Marco with the string quartet at Caf Florian playing merrily in the background. A freshly baked brioche - still warm from the oven - and a pot of jasmine tea to keep me going
The view onto the water from Piazza San Marco. Ever the same, and ever enchanting. Most especially on a day like today when the air feels warm and the water shimmers in the sunshine

My tips on where to eat in Venice in The Dish, out with The Sunday Times today. I am also sharing some of my most loved recipes, and the story of how Venice came to be my home. Would love for you to read it! Xx @sundaytimesfood

Completely over the moon to wake up to this cover of The Dish, out with The Sunday Times this morning. I am still pinching myself, and can't quite believe it. Thank you @laurelives - it is a truly stunning issue, and I feel so proud and honoured to be a part of it! Xx @sundaytimesfood

It's always a treat when recipe testing turns into dinner. Particularly delighted with this way of cooking sea bream: baked in the oven with a glass of white wine, figs, almonds and a a few sprigs of rosemary. @giselaatlarge

Orange blossom ricotta cake - deliciously light and gooey in the middle, and peppered with chunks of candied peel soaked in brandy. A very lovely treat for afternoon tea. You can find the recipe, together with some of my other most loved recipes, in The Dish in The Sunday Times, out tomorrow - I really am so excited to share these with you! Xx @SundayTimesFood

Tonight's dessert is @anthonysantospirito's favourite: rosewater meringues with whipped mascarpone cream and strawberries drenched in lemon syrup. Feels like a nice start to the weekend PS more on @sundaytimesfood - I'm excited to be taking over their account all day today!

Beautiful Amalfi lemons for 'tagliolini al limone'. They smell and taste like Spring. I'm taking over the @sundaytimesfood Instagram account all day today - please follow along for lots of recipes and sneak peeks into my kitchen! Would love to see you over there! Xx

A lazy start to the day today with boiled eggs and toast in bed after a late, but devilishly fun dinner last night. Also, exciting news: I am taking over the @sundaytimesfood Instagram account tomorrow! I can't wait to share lots of snippets and recipes from my kitchen and would really love for you to follow along... Xx
Tea, followed by tea and cakes with the loveliest @pipmccormac at Caf Royal. Chatting food, flowers and all of my favourite things

Finishing off lunch with a pot of fresh mint tea, and a plate of sweet pastry tarts, laden with mascarpone cream and sharp raspberries. Could happily linger here, cup of tea in hand, whiling the afternoon away
Cozy dinner for two tonight: ruby rare roast beef with the crispiest baby potatoes, and a peppery watercress salad. Creamy tiramis to follow. @anthonysantospirito

Curling up with a a cup of hot tea and a raspberry tart, after a busy day of meetings here in London. And making plans for the months ahead, including a trip to NY at the end of May. So looking forward to it - do you have any tips for where to eat, shop and play while I'm there? Xx
More fairy cakes than I can count - iced with thick lavender scented icing and decorated with sugar dipped flowers. @lacoquetakids @houseofhackney
Someone found the batch of fairy cakes, thought they might do nicely for breakfast in bed, and ended up with lavender icing on the tip of their nose... @lacoquetakids

A deeply satisfying day in the kitchen today: sixty four baby tomato tartlets baked; and seventy two fairy cakes made and iced with lavender sugar for tomorrow's tea party. Plus a couple extra for my supper tonight
Supper tonight is a simple spaghetti alla carbonara. But it's ending with a creamy zabaione and amaretto pudding
And the preparations for the tea party on Saturday have begun... More meringues baking slowly in the oven; home smells like a heady mix of rosewater and dark chocolate. @lacoquetakids @houseofhackney
Crispy duck, potatoes and bunches of sweet grapes roasting in the oven. A bottle of wine sitting open on the kitchen counter; and lots of Spring flowers for the dining table
I treated myself to breakfast at Caf Florian this morning. It came on a silver tray - then I sat sipping tea and watching the world go by, as their quintet played merry tunes

When life gives you lemons...you make tagliolini with a creamy lemon and thyme sauce. New post on the blog now! I'm so excited to be sharing this recipe: not only has it fast made its way to the top of my list of favourites, but somehow it just tastes like Spring. Find the link in my profile should it take your fancy _ buon appetito! Xx
Caught while multitasking: shelling peas and catching the last of today's glorious sunshine in the garden. 'Risi e bisi' - a creamy, soupy garden risotto - is in the offing for dinner tonight

Ensconced back in sleepy Castello after a fun day speeding around the lagoon, enjoying the glorious sunshine and eating too much good food. Thank you @russell_norman for an exquisite lunch and a very fun day out! Xx
Playing around in the kitchen. Enjoying the late afternoon sunshine pouring in through the window, and the sound of the birds chirruping merrily in the trees

Just landed back in Venice. Happy to be driving through the winding canals again; still entranced by the magical patterns reflected in the water. And better still: today is all glorious sunshine and piercing blue skies. Follow along on snapchat (skyemcalpine) for a sneak peek

Dinner tossed together in haste: tagliolini doused in a creamy lemon sauce with heaps of heavenly-scented thyme. So simple, but somehow so very decadent. Looking forward to sharing this recipe with you on the blog... It's been too long since I last posted

Pear and gorgonzola cheese on crusty bread has to be one of the most heavenly combinations. I'm thrilled to be sharing the recipe for these 'crostini' and other 'cichetti' on @food52 today. As well as talking about why 'cichetti' are my go-to to serve at dinners and parties alike

Poached langoustines and white asparagus dipped in saffron mayonnaise. Then guineafowl cooked in the best part of a bottle of prosecco with roasted grapes and pan fried baby artichokes on the side. Best of all the company - @doriscoops please come and visit us again soon! Xx
Home feels like Spring this morning. Heady with the sweet scent of fresh flowers - and the even sweeter scent of ripe strawberries
The makings of a cozy night in: a simple spaghetti aglio, olio e peperoncino, followed by a bowl of strawberries drenched in zabaione custard

Town is bustling today - and I'm rushing around, running errands and taking meetings. Hoping to finish up in time to enjoy a spritz by the waterside while the day is still light and the afternoon sun is still shining
All ensconced in what has to be one of the prettiest spots in town, as well as one of the cosiest. Sipping tea, munching on 'biscottini' and writing away

Ambling through the back streets to a chorus of echoing church bells, and going about the business that is every day. As much as I love to travel, I am always happy to be home - especially when the sun is shining, like to today. Join me on snapchat (skyemcalpine) for what feels like the first proper day of Spring in this quiet little corner of Venice

I arrived back in Venice late last night, when the streets were all dark and empty. I curled into bed, slept the sleep of the dead (after a busy few days teaching at a cookery workshop on the Isle of Wight) and treated myself to breakfast in bed when I woke up this morning

At first dawn this morning, I hopped into a water taxi and headed to the airport. A plane, car and ferry journey later I find myself on the Isle of Wight, which is all idyllic seaside views and where I am excited to be co-hosting a cooking course over the next few days. Above all I am excited (and honoured) to be working alongside two cooks whose work and writing I admire hugely, Rose Prince and Josceline Dimbleby

The one dish I can never say no to is tiramis. Here made to Maria's old recipe (and the best recipe for tiramis I have ever found) - with proper savoiardi biscuits (essential), strong coffee and lashings of mascarpone
What a beautiful day for a gondola ride! And how very handsome this gondolier looks in his brilliant whites

This morning the air was thick with fog, and I could barely see past my nose. Then the sun came out and brought with it the most beautiful Spring day. Now we're strolling around town in search of a good gelato

Lunch today was a buttery roast leg of lamb with rosemary potatoes, pan fried baby artichokes and garden peas. And then the most heavenly sugar iced 'colomba' (Easter cake) for pudding. Buona Pasqua! I hope that you're enjoying a lazy and peaceful day... Xx
Walking through the back streets, enjoying the sunshine and the cheerful echo of the church bells. Then a spoiling breakfast of brioche and cappuccino at Caf Florain, followed by an Easter egg hunt

The table all laid up for Saturday lunch, laden with pink camellias from our garden. Then came the 'risotto di bruscandoli' (wild hop risotto), baby artichokes and chargrilled radicchio, and the sugary 'colomba' (Easter cake) with lashings of 'zabaione'. @romilly_mca @anthonysantospirito

We treated ourselves to lunch at a cozy trattoria: baked tomino cheese (so good!), followed by a big plate of tagliolini with yellow saffron and scampi. Then, we went for a lovely long stroll through the back streets and somehow almost got lost

Apple, rose and thyme tart - one of my favourite and most trusted recipes. I've baked it time and time again over the years, and yet somehow never tire of eating it! You can find the recipe in the archives on my blog (link in profile) should it take your fancy too

I can't think of a lovelier way to celebrate my birthday than with a picnic. Views out over the open lagoon and sitting under dappled shade in a dreamy vineyard on the island of Sant'Erasmo. Torta pasqualina, hard boiled eggs with anchovies (it's not a proper picnic without eggs), saffron infused pecorino cheese, freshly baked bread and more strawberries than I could possibly eat. Grazie @bellinitravel, @mariashollenbarger and @romilly_mca for a magical day!! Xx

Tea and toast with @bellinitravel and @mariashollenbarger first thing this morning before setting out in our little wooden boat to explore the wilder corners of the lagoon. Follow along on our boating adventures on snapchat (skyemcalpine)! Xx

It seems a little indulgent to buy flowers for myself when I fly to Venice tomorrow and will only be able to really enjoy them for one night - but I still couldn't resist. A very fine bunch of tulips now perched by my bedside and making me very happy. @nikkitibbleswildatheart

The very best kind of working lunch today with @lacoquetakids at one of my favourite London restaurants, @springrest. We made all sorts of exciting plans for an upcoming collaboration together, and ate too much (is there such a thing?!) of the exquisite tagliolini cooked in butter and sage

We're improvising supper tonight: making a 'farinata' (salted chickpea pancake), then topping it with leftovers from the fridge. Looks like it's going to be some variation on the theme of rocket leaves, walnuts and chunks of creamy Gorgonzola
Brewing a pot of tea, and taking a moment to enjoy the longer days (finally here!), the late afternoon sunshine beaming in through our window, and the last few pages of my book

Aeneas is tucked up in bed, and I'm typing away working to a deadline for an article. No time to cook, so I'm nourishing myself with a good salame, crusty bread and a hunk of gorgonzola cheese. Also wine

Sunday afternoon baking and the makings of supper. This is the second time just this week that I have made this coffee and walnut cake. I'm looking forward to a slice after dinner tonight, and another for breakfast tomorrow morning... The recipe is on the blog (link in profile) should you fancy it too! Xx
A pot of hot jasmine tea and munching our way through a box of my favourite amaretto biscuits - the kind that are sugary and crisp on the outside, but all lovely and chewy on the inside

An early and spoiling start to the weekend today: the loveliest afternoon tea (with salted caramel macaroons) in a cozy corner at @sketchlondon with @vickiarcher. Then I treated myself to a bunch of tulips and daffodils on the way home

Salt baked sea bass and fennel tarts for dinner last night. Then strawberries with mascarpone cream and walnut cake. And the very loveliest of company - the kind where you linger around the table chatting and laughing and sipping on prosecco until well past midnight. Thank you @cultofg, @lauralclare, @elizahopps, @michaellynas and @markpotton for a wonderful evening! Xx

to a blustery Sunday spent gossiping and strolling through the streets of Venice with @gilchristanna4. We ended up seeking cover from the rain (as well as hot chocolate and biscotti) in a little coffee shop and somehow the day just whiled away

Freshly baked 'Sfogliatelle di Finocchio e Pecorino' (puff pastry tarts with fennel and pecorino cheese) - still warm from the oven, ready and waiting for dinner tonight. @anthonysantospirito @michaellynas @markpotton @mayymcalil @lauralclare @elizahopps

Tossing together an 'insalata di carciofini' (baby artichoke salad). Barely a recipe - just tender baby artichoke leaves, olive oil, salt and a little lemon juice - but one of my favourites, as it somehow always feels fancy even though it is so simple to make. You can find the full recipe among the archives on my blog (link in profile) and a short video of me tossing the salad together on snapchat (skyemcalpine

Filling the house with sunny daffodils and pastel pink tulips. The days are getting longer, and the skies brighter. I spotted Italian strawberries and sweet garden peas for sale at the market only last week. This morning I went for a stroll without a scarf - and didn't feel cold

The most indulgent of breakfasts in bed this morning: hot buttered toast, soft boiled egg, sweet jasmine tea and a couple of chapters of 'Pride and Prejudice' (one of my all-time favourite reads) for me. Chocolate biscuits and 'The Aristocats' (the timeless Disney classic) for Aeneas

I was woken at first dawn by this little one. He came brandishing a chocolate biscuit (for breakfast in bed) and eager to snuggle. Can't think of a more heavenly start to Mother's Day... Wishing all you lovely Mammas a very happy and spoiling day too! Xx

Roast chicken; butternut squash roasted in the oven, swimming in butter with heaps of fresh sage; and crispy potatoes. Then a 'colomba' (that heavenly Italian Easter cake with candied peek and sugary almonds) with strawberries and zabaione cream to finish the meal off. Many bottles of wine and the very loveliest of company. Feels like the weekend is well underway already
So proud of my baby boy modelling for the @lacoquetakids Spring/Summer lookbook. And so proud of my dear friend Celia for designing such a uniquely beautiful collection! Xx

Baking from an old Venetian cookbook today - a dog eared paperback that I found in a second hand book shop and which I think is now (sadly) long out of print. These beautiful lemons are for a 'torta al limone' (lemon cake): you blend poached lemons with whole almonds and sugar, then mix with eggs (that have been beaten until they become as light as air) to make a wonderfully delicate and sweet scented batter

In my book, Sundays are for pottering in the kitchen and for baking. A current favourite is this coffee and walnut cake, layered with thick mascarpone icing. The recipe is on the blog now (link in my profile), should it take your fancy too... Xx

Today was mostly taken up with the business of cooking and eating lunch - my favourite way to spend a rainy Saturday. Crostini with lardo, chestnut honey and rosemary; fish soup (made with wonderfully flavourful scorpion fish, star anise, whole cinnamon sticks and all manner of other goodness); and rose meringues with saffron zabaione to finish a very decadent meal off. Best of all, though: the company. Thank you @ben.tish, @chefjamiethickett, @clerkenwellboyec1, @nykeetatish and @ben_quinton - it was a treat! Xx

Tender baby artichokes at the Rialto market first this morning, just begging to be tossed in a salad with a little parsley and lemon. A busy day today, shopping for groceries, running around town and making preparations for the feast we're cooking up with @ben.tish tomorrow. It's been a treat to work in the kitchen alongside such a talented and inspiring chef, and I can't wait to see what delights he magics up for our lunch tomorrow

Today was catching up on (long overdue) correspondence; reorganising our kitchen (the rather satisfying task of labelling and tidying ingredients into jars); and running errands. Then a quick spritz and a few cichetti at our local

Rich hot chocolate and buttery biscuits at the bar at Hotel Danieli - which somehow with its sparkling chandeliers, worn damask chairs and the grand piano playing softly in the background feels never changing and ever filled with old world glamour. See more on snapchat (skyemcalpine

A nice start to the week today with a busy morning of meetings in town, making all sorts plans for exciting projects in the coming months. Then a brisk walk home to a lunch of minestrone, veal chop and chargrilled radicchio
I am excited to be taking over the @guardian_cook account this weekend, sharing some of my favourite recipes and kitchen inspiration. Hope you're having a lovely and lazy Sunday! Xx

Just landed back in a sunny, but very cold Venice after a lovely, restful few days visiting my father-in-law in Dubai. Somehow, it always makes my heart sing that this is the view from the water taxi on the drive in from the airport

New post on 'From My Dining Table'! Sharing the recipe for these fennel and pecorino tartlets; a lovely, warming white wine soup; and a coffee walnut cake with mascarpone icing... Find the link in my profile! Buon Appetito!! Xx

Excited to be taking over the @guardian_cook Instagram account this weekend, sharing favourite recipes and inspiration from my kitchen. Would love for you to follow along too... Xx PS this apple, rose and thyme tart is an old favourite of mine, and should you fancy baking it this weekend, you can find the recipe in the archives on my blog (link in profile)!

Sharing a slice of last night's coffee and walnut cake (with a dash of mascarpone icing) for breakfast this morning. With a hot pot of coffee. Then packing our bags, a fast boat ride to Venice airport, and flying to sunny Dubai where we will be visiting my father-in-law for a few days

White wine soup for dinner tonight. With crusty bread for dipping, and more wine for drinking. Coffee and walnut cake with sweet mascarpone icing, freshly baked this morning, for dessert. I can't think of a lovelier way to spend this evening than in the kitchen, cooking and eating with those that I love. Hope that you're having a spoiling Valentines too! Xx

It's raining and it's pouring outside. @anthonysantospirito and I put on our wellington boots and made our way through the puddles and high tides to celebrate Valentine's Day at the prettiest caf in town. Hot chocolate, whipped cream and buttery lemon biscuits (for dipping) all round. @caffeflorian

We arrived back in Venice late last night, after a busy few days of meetings in London. When we landed at the airport it was pouring with rain, but by the time we woke up this morning the skies were beautiful, and crisp, and clear. Strolling around town today, running errands, making a couple of hot chocolate stops and enjoying the winter sunshine
Settling down with a hot cup of tea, cake and a very good book, while I wait for the loveliest @scribbleanddaub to arrive. Tea and cakes aplenty waiting for her when she does

to last Valentine's Day, when I baked this rose scented sponge cake with saffron 'Zabaione' cream filling. You can find the recipe in the archives on 'From My Dining Table' (link in profile). It's still a favourite recipe - very lightly adapted from the wonderfully decadent 'zabaione' cake they serve at Harry's Bar in Venice
Sharing my go-to, go-with-everything dinner party side dishes on @food52 today. Including the recipe for this caramelised red onion tarte tatin which has become a staple at our dining table

A big thank you to @yahoofood for the lovely feature about 'From My Dining Table' today! Each day this week they will be showcasing one of my recipes, starting with an all-time favourite: my buttery 'spaghetti all'astice' (spaghetti with lobster

Spoiling ourselves to a buttery Victoria sponge for late afternoon tea today. Layered with mascarpone cheese and the most heavenly rose & raspberry jam (I cooked up a batch a few weeks ago to a lovely recipe from @newtonandpott's beautiful cookbook). Home is now filled with the scent of baked cake and freshly brewed coffee - and feels very cozy indeed PS more on snapchat (skyemcalpine)! Xx

I spent most of today playing around in the kitchen, recipe testing a rose-scented shortbread, and a buttery red onion onion tarte tatin. I've just opened a bottle of white, sliced into a nice salame and now we're calling it dinner

Sea bass for dinner tonight, stuffed with herbs and juicy lemons, then baked in a salt crust. To be eaten with a crisp green salad, a few rosemary roasted potatoes and a generous splash of good olive oil

The house has that cozy, weekend feel to it already. Pink roses dotted here, there and everywhere. A tray of Italian sausages and sweet apples roasting in the oven. Walnut cake all ready for dessert, table laid and a bottle of red opened @anthonysantospirito

A working lunch at @springrest with @bellinitravel and @mariashollenbarger. Anchovy beignets, roasted carrots, baked ricotta, the most exquisitely delicate ravioli, then rare and finely sliced roast beef. And a dark chocolate tart topped with honeycomb and clotted cream to finish us off

Today started well. I woke up before dawn - my favourite time of day, when all is peaceful and quiet. I put the kettle on and set about the business of mixing up a thick cake batter. By the time the rest of the house woke up too, there was chocolate & walnut cake, still warm from the oven, for us to all enjoy for breakfast Ps more cake on snapchat (skyemcalpine)! Xx

Pink garden roses, wild blossoms and Scottish thistle filling our kitchen with the sweet scent of Spring. So spoiling to be given such a beautiful bunch of flowers - and the loveliest reminder of a dinner greedily enjoyed with friends. Thank you @mayymcalil! Xx

Such a treat to come home to find an envelope waiting for me on our doormat: a lovely hand written letter from friends who live on the other side of the world. I settled down to read it with a pot of hot, sweet tea and a crisp rose scented meringue. Thank you @cleo__rose and @james.talbot - we miss you on this side of the pond! Xx

This cold winter weather has me craving comfort food. So, supper tonight is tagliatelle with gorgonzola, pear and walnuts (the recipe - which is an all-time favourite of mine - is on my blog). Oven roasted artichokes with pecorino and heaps of fresh parsley. And a loaf of freshly baked bread slathered in butter PS follow along on snapchat (skyemcalpine) for more behind the scenes! Xx

Dotting bunches of flowers around the house and putting the final touches on the table for dinner tonight. Veal loin roasting in the oven, a heap of rose meringues and a big bowl of saffron scented zabaione waiting to be devoured. All ready for our guests to arrive
I had the loveliest start to this weekend: I woke up to this gorgeous feature about my blog in The Times. And then I was spoiled to breakfast in bed. @kellypreedyphoto @katiewilsonfoto

It feels like such a luxury to wake up in our bedroom, now that the walls are clad in this pretty pink wallpaper. I long to curl up in bed with nothing but a pot of hot jasmine tea and my very worn copy of 'Crime & Punishment' (which has too long been lying on my bedside table and is next on my to-read list)... And then just stay there all weekend

I spent this afternoon playing around in the kitchen, doing what I love to do: baking. I made buttery shortbread biscuits to my great Aunt's tried, tested and much, much loved recipe. And then we ate them for afternoon tea, still warm from the oven PS Follow along on snapchat (skyemcalpine) for the recipe and a sneak peek into the kitchen! Xx
Tips for improvising a stylish dinner party from the staples you have sitting in your pantry, in my latest piece for @food52

There is something about the Venetian lagoon and the little islands dotted around it that I find endlessly romantic. Not sure if it's the light, the the pastel coloured houses or the wonderfully slow pace of things. Either way - I am very happy to be contributing a piece to @cucina_corriere today sharing my most favourite spots to eat, stroll and laze there, should you want to explore that beautiful part of Italy too

I flew back to London on the late flight last night. I have a couple of exciting work meetings coming up as well as dates with friends who I long to see. But this lovely picture from @local_milk of the two of us enjoying Piazza San Marco all to ourselves (while sipping on the most decadent hot chocolate) has me wishing that I had made plans to stay in town just a little while longer. January, when the sun shines and the air is crisp, is one of the most magical months in Venice

Running errands around town this morning: shopping for a really good saffron pecorino at the cheese shop hidden away at the foot of the Rialto bridge; picking up a bag of artichokes from the friendly fruit and veg stall in Campo Santa Maria Formosa; and stopping off for a spritz and cichetti (or two) along the way. More of secret Venice on snapchat (skyemcalpine

Breakfast on the final day of my workshop with @local_milk. Brioche filled with sweet apricot jam, focaccia still slightly warm from the bakery, pears, prosciutto, pecorino peppered with pistachios, and all things good. It has been such a treat to spend the past few days with our guests, who are truly one lovelier than the other

I spent most of this morning strolling through the back streets, ambling over bridges and enjoying the soft, winter sunshine. Then I treated myself to hot chocolate and whipped cream in the rococo tearooms at Caf Florian with @local_milk, @studio_neon and @londonsrose

The past few days have been a whirlwind of extravagant meals, cozy afternoon teas and lazy strolls through Venice's backstreets. Tonight we dressed up and are donning fancy masks. We're eating chocolate focaccia and sipping on prosecco by candlelight. And so begins the Carneval

Today we set out on wooden speedboats and left the bustling centre of Venice behind us. @local_milk and I took our guests to the sleepy island of Burano. Lunch was more courses than I could count, and involved seafood cooked every which way imaginable. Think gnocchi with smoked cheese and scampi, and the most delicate of fish risotti. A sharp coffee and a 'buranello' biscuit to polish the meal off, then a lazy stroll through these colourful streets and another breezy boat ride home. I can't think of a more lovely way to spend the day ps to see more from our lagoon adventure, follow along on snapchat (skyemcalpine)! Xx

Carneval is all about excess. In my book, that means zabaione custard filled 'frittelle' (raisin doughnuts) and 'galani' (fine, flaky sheets of pastry) drenched in icing sugar. And then sugary almond 'focaccia' and buttery jam biscuits. All of which @local_milk and I laid out for afternoon tea with our lovely guests. And all of which we devoured greedily

I have eaten until I can eat no more. Lunch was the most exquisite seafood and tomato pasta, plates of steaming langoustines and chargrilled mackerel to follow - all cooked to perfection by @studio_neon. Sugary 'focaccia', biscuits and gelato for afternoon tea. And a supper of risotto and tiramis - the kind of nourishing food that is my comfort food. More on snapchat (skyemcalpine) - would love for you to follow along! Xx

I loved @emikodavies' evocative account of her time in Piemonte (and of all the exquisite food she ate) in Corriere della Sera yesterday. I am so excited to be contributing to a new series about the food of Italy, alongside some of my favourite food writers including @marte_marie_forsberg, @katieparla and @valdirose. My article on the culinary quirks of the Venetian lagoon will be published next week. Photo of me (bundled up in a very warm coat and leafing excitedly through the paper) snapped by @local_milk. @cucina_corriere @angelafrenda

First day of my workshop with @local_milk: up bright and early this morning for a breakfast of freshly baked brioche and hot chocolate, then a lazy stroll through the city with our guests to visit the market and gather some last minute ingredients for dinner tonight. Pizza topped with walnuts, honey and radicchio for lunch. Can't think of a lovelier way to spend the day, or better company to spend it in. Ps follow along on snapchat (skyemcalpine) to peek behind the scenes! Xx

New post on the blog! Sharing the most decadent recipe for 'tagliatelle' with Gorgonzola, pear & walnuts...and this old and favourite recipe for pomegranate, meringue & rose semifreddo... Find the link in my profile! Xx
Heavenly baby artichokes at the market this morning. Almost too pretty to eat. Almost
Grazie 'Corriere della Sera' for including me in your list of top foodies to follow on @instagram. I am truly honoured! Xx @cucina_corriere @corriere_it @angelafrenda

Strolling through town, running errands and putting together the final touches for my workshop with @local_milk, @studio_neon and @londonsrose tomorrow. So excited to welcome our guests and show them round the city! Also, I've just joined Snapchat: follow along for behind the scenes and sneak peeks of my favourite hidden corners of Venice - my handle is 'skyemcalpine'.
Matching my favourite tweed @vibivenezia slippers to the sunny yellow reflection in the water @veraarrivabene @anthonysantospirito

I was intrigued by this 'fregolotta' (a biscuit-y cake of sorts) made with 'radicchio' (red chicory!) when I saw a tray of them in the window of our local bakery this morning. So I bought one (still warm from the oven) and we devoured it over a hot pot of coffee at home. So exquisitely buttery and more-ish - I am now determined to recreate the recipe in my kitchen

Today was a long day travelling, so I am feeling very happy to be back in this peaceful little corner of the world. And very lucky to be looking out on to this view that somehow still, for all the years I have lived here, seems magical to me

Celebrating the start of the weekend with a tray of rose scented meringues. To be eaten with copious quantities of whipped cream and an extravagant dash of crushed pomegranate. I was so surprised and excited today to find myself featured on the @telegraphfood top-foodies-to-follow list. @felicityspector - the biggest thank you for including me! I am honoured. Xx

Talking about 'cucina povera' and sharing tips for hosting parties on a shoestring in my latest piece for @food52. As well as this favourite recipe for 'farinata' (chickpea pancake) with honey, pear, rocket and pecorino (which I am also cooking for dinner with friends tonight!)... Xx

Feeling very happy that I decided to spoil myself with a big bunch of flowers today. It's bitterly cold outside, but these cheerful narcissi have the promise of spring about them. And they smell impossibly sweet

It always feels like a treat when recipe testing turns into dinner... Devouring this crispy 'farinata' (chickpea flour pancake) smothered in fresh rocket, runny honey, pear and shavings of Parmesan with a nice glass of white tonight
A lazy and very spoiling start to the day with a pot of steaming hot coffee in bed. Pondering which wallpaper to choose for the walls in our bedroom (any thoughts?), and what to cook for lunch today
A posy of pink roses to put by my bedside, next to the pile of novels that one day I will get round to reading
Orange blossom ricotta cake laced with brandy soaked raisins and still deliciously warm from the oven. And then a slice of (very rich) fruitcake with marzipan and glac fruit icing
I've been tied to my desk all day, writing up recipes, notes and stories. Somehow there doesn't seem to have been the time to cook a proper meal, so I've settled for a bruschetta instead
Long walks and many, many hot chocolate stops
One of the loveliest things about having friends visit us in Venice is the excuse to play tourist in some of the prettiest corners of the city
Hello sailor @anthonysantospirito
The sun setting on 2015... Wishing you health, happiness and all manner of exciting adventures this coming year! Buon anno!! Xx

Happy to be sharing my tips for dressing up comfort food (including my favourite recipe for truffled maccheroni and cheese) on @food52 today! Just in time for any last minute New Year's Eve celebrations
Celebrating the last day of the year with Bellinis and Shirley Temples, and the very best of friends
Something about the city cloaked in silent fog that takes my breath away
The makings of dinner
Ambling through the back streets, hopping from one 'bacaro' to another for nibbles and spritz

Hot chocolate and buttery croissants for breakfast, a visit from Father Christmas, a long stroll along the waterfront in the winter sunshine, and now we're sitting down to lunch... @anthonysantospirito @jo_rodgers @subtlegoose @romilly_mca
Sharing a little Christmas treat and my favourite recipe for mince pies on the blog today... Wishing you the happiest of Christmases!! Xx
Happy Christmas!! Love from Skye, Anthony and Aeneas Xx
A spoiling lunch at Harry's Bar followed by hot chocolate in the prettiest tea rooms in Venice with @jo_rodgers, @subtlegoose and @anthonysantospirito. Then home for some last minute present wrapping
Christmas shopping at the fruit and veg barge
Sharing some of my favourite recipes (including this creamy pannacotta with persimmon and amaretto sauce) and thoughts on Christmas traditions on the blog today... Xx
The loveliest morning spent sipping hot chocolate and strolling through the city shrouded in fog with @jo_rodgers
Wrapping presents and listening to carols. It's beginning to feel a lot like Christmas... And I'm happy to be sharing my favourite recipe for festive mulled wine on the @westelm blog today

Tips for how to feed a crowd (and stay sane) at Christmas in my latest column for @food52. As well as my favourite recipe for brandy butter (particularly good smeared over toasted panettone for breakfast
Freshly baked mince pies, brandy butter, twinkling lights and carols humming softly in the background
Happy to be sharing my recipe for 'Crostata di Noci e Caramello' (Walnut and Caramel Tart) on the @westelm blog
We're getting very excited about Christmas
Spending this afternoon in the kitchen. My favourite place to be
White truffle maccheroni and cheese for supper tonight. @anthonysantospirito
A beautiful and spoiling bunch of pink roses filling the house with their heady scent
Finishing off dessert for the loveliest ladies dinner with @petra_palumbo, @haypal, @lanarpalumbo and @romilly_mca
to a lazy afternoon spent strolling around the island of Mazzorbo. (Photo snapped by the loveliest @marte_marie_forsberg
Working on a recipe for pomegranate semifreddo for an upcoming column. The leftovers turned into supper
It's beginning to feel a lot like Christmas... I'm excited and honoured to be sharing my tips for how to lay a festive table on the @lacoquetakids blog today! Xx
This apple pie (with a buttery walnut crumble topping and a cream cheese pastry crust) is one of my all-time favourites. Happy to be sharing the recipe on @cucina_corriere this weekend
Getting in the mood for the weekend with a little baking
Excited and honoured to be sharing some of my favourite festive recipes on the @lacoquetakids blog today: Candied Orange & Star Anise Upside Down Cake and Spiced Hot Apple Juice
Market greens
Tips for hosting a very merry Christmas party (as well a recipe for Meringue, Chocolate and Marrons Glac Cake) in my latest column for @food52
Exploring Burano with @giselaatlarge
Thank you @zeitmagazin for the lovely feature today. I'm excited and honoured to share my recipes with your readers! Xx
Exploring the glass factories on Murano with @giselaatlarge this morning. Then stopped off for athe most delicious plate of 'spaghetti con bottarga
Happiness is... starting the day with a bag of presents from your godfather. Thank you @evanmerali! Xx
My favourite kind of party. The kind where you end up lingering over coffee and pavlova until the (not so) early hours of the morning. Happy birthday @anthonysantospirito
The first of two birthday pavlovas (this one with whipped cream, marrons glac and sugar dipped violets) for @anthonysantospirito
Treating ourselves to the creamiest pannacotta drenched in kaki and amaretto syrup. Happy thanksgiving!! Xx
Arranging small posies of flowers to dot along the dining table
There's a winter chill in the air today. Warming myself with a pot of hot, spiced apple juice
to when Aeneas was just this high, and frolicking around on Wagner's sofa
Happy to be sharing my tips for hosting a relaxed and potluck Thanksgiving dinner on @food52 today... As well as a recipe for pear and chestnut pie. Xx

Only a few tickets left for the creative retreat which I am excited to be hosting in Venice this January with wonderfully talented photographer @local_milk. There will be much cooking and eating involved. As well as boat rides through the open lagoon, and drinks parties by the light of glittering Murano glass chandeliers. For more information or to reserve a room at the palazzo, find the link in @local_milk's profile
Happy to be sharing one of my favourite recipes on @cucina_corriere today: Chocolate Chestnut Meringue Pie

And... so excited to announce a photography and styling retreat with @local_milk in Venice this coming January. Three days (Jan 21-25) in one of the dreamiest palazzi on the Grand Canal, a boat ride through the misty lagoon to explore the island of Burano and a masked cocktail party. As well as a chance to explore The city at one of my favourite times of the year - and all manner of deliciousness cooked by @studio_neon. Tickets are on sale now - find the link in @local_milk's profile. Can't wait! Xx

I am so excited to finally announce that I will be coming to Australia next October! I am honoured to be teaching a photography, writing and styling workshop with the loveliest and talented @luisabrimble and @locallovely. The workshop will take place at Kimbri Farm in the stunningly beautiful Blue Mountains on October 5th-6th. Tickets are on sale now - you can find the link in @locallovely's profile. Hope to see you there! Xx
The lazy lunch that turned into dinner @evanmerali @michaellynas @ariana_ruth @anthonysantospirito
Brewing the first mulled wine of the season
Pear and sweet chestnut tart. Freshly baked and still warm from the oven
In our thoughts and prayers
Leftover baked goods. Enough to last us for days

Such a fun afternoon with @kellypreedyphoto. Chatting about so many of my favourite things (namely shoes, cake and Venetian weddings). Over a pot of jasmine tea, cinnamon sugar biscuits and a slice (or two) of candied orange & almond upside down cake
The business of Sunday lunch
Lazy Saturday baking with @elizahopps. And one too many helpings of 'Crostata di Noci e Caramello' (Honeyed Caramel Walnut Tart
My tips for how to seat guests at a dinner party on @food52 today! Xx
Love these days of late autumn sunshine, when you can still enjoy lunch in the open air, sitting by the water

Watching the sun set on a beautiful day spent shooting with @simonpwatson. Such a treat to have an excuse to explore the hidden corners of the Venetian lagoon, and to stop off at all my favourite restaurants along the way
Happy Halloween! Xx
New post on the blog (finally)! With lots of cozy, autumnal recipes, including my favourite for 'Torta di Mele Cotogne e Brandy' (Quince and Brandy Cake)... Xx
Hands down the best spot in town for hot chocolate. Especially on a cold and blustery day like today
Tips and tricks for estimating how much food to serve at dinner parties in my column on @food52
Happy third birthday to my gorgeous baby boy!! Not such a baby anymore. I can't believe how quickly time is flying by... @anthonysantospirito
Settling down with a warming bowl of white grape risotto and a glass of wine

Packing up the glasses and the crockery, folding away the damask tablecloths and closing the shutters, as our stay this beautiful palazzo draws to an end. These past few days have been a whirlwind and such a treat to work with the loveliest @marte_marie_forsberg
Gorgonzola, pears, plums, salty focaccia (still warm from the oven and drenched in olive oil), salame, prosciutto and all things good
Watching the city come to life on a sunny Sunday morning. So lucky to call this quirky little town - with its old buildings, fading colours and peaceful waters - home
Lovely start to the day with this steaming cup of Turkish coffee that @edaidlam brought for me all the way from Istanbul
Plum and whipped mascarpone tarts all laid up for afternoon tea in the prettiest drawing fm room in Venice

The remnants of a heavenly meal. Creamy 'burrata' peppered with pomegranate seeds, spaghetti with the freshest seafood from the Rialto fish market, and then a 'crema inglese' to top it all. @marte_marie_forsberg

Out and about, strolling through the streets of Venice with @marte_marie_forsberg, @ariana_ruth and our loveliest workshop guests. Chattering and musing and having an all round jolly time. Then this pretty pink house caught my eye
Golden hues, deep ruby reds and all shapes and sizes of autumn bounty heaped high on our dining table

Spent this afternoon making ready for the retreat which @marte_marie_forsberg and I are hosting together tomorrow. Couldn't help but linger on the terrace at the beautiful palazzo which will be our home for the next few days. Utterly captivated by the magical view and the piercing blue skies

So excited to be contributing a new baking column for @cucina_corriere. You can find the recipe for this roasted plum, mascarpone and pistachio pavlova (my husband's favourite!) online on their site now... Buon appetito! Xx
Apple and walnut pie in the making, to an old and favourite recipe
Watching the sun set behind the Venice skyline, as we bob along on the water in our little boat
Thank you @fionajoye and @nikkitibbleswildatheart for the prettiest posy of flowers. Our kitchen is heady with the scent of overblown roses
Market finds
Baby fig tartlets in the making. Somehow feels like the last whisper of summertime
A little weekend baking... Chocolate, chestnut, almond and rosemary cake (an old and favourite recipe from the blog) topped with whipped mascarpone icing
My favourite kind of dinner with @lacoquetakids last night. The kind where you chat and eat and chat some more, then realise that it's almost midnight and somehow you've whiled the whole night away

Buongiorno Milano! Treated myself to breakfast in bed (a freshly baked 'cornetto' and a pot of hot tea), then curled up under the sheets and read my book ('The Great Game' by Peter Hopkirk) for longer than its probably decent to lie in bed. @maisonborella

I am so excited to announce that I will be in Milan this Friday speaking at @tempodelledonne about food and the magical part that it plays in family life. I will be there with @angelafrenda and @mammapapera. If you're in Milan, I would absolutely love it if you stopped by - 12.30pm at la Triennale di Milano! Xx @cucina_corriere @corrieredellasera
Magical dinner with @petra_palumbo, @bellinitravel, @tatianahambro and @michaellynas. Confit duck legs, marrons glac semifreddo and the very best of company
Fig, ricotta, thyme and almond 'crostata' for breakfast. With a little coffee on the side
A little Friday afternoon baking; music playing in the background; sun shining. Can't think of a nicer way to get into the mood for the weekend
Filling the house with pretty white roses. Something about fresh cut flowers that has a way of making a house feel like a home
The dreamiest almond and cinnamon 'biancomangiare' (pudding, for lack of a better word in English
An apple a day... @lacoquetakids

Table laid for dinner: baby tomato and balsamic tarte tartin (a favourite old recipe from my blog), bread, all manner of cheeses, salumi, pears and a vegetable farro salad. And then tiramis for dessert
Working on a piece about Venice for @condenasttraveller. Some fig and mascarpone tartlets and a nice coffee to keep me going
New post on 'From My Dining Table' with lots of recipes inspired by our recent trip to Puglia - including these irresistibly buttery 'rustici Leccesi' (mozzarella and tomato pies

A very late (and exquisite) lunch of rillettes, saucisson and crusty bread at @buvetteparis; one last stroll through the sun dappled streets of Paris - and then home (with a suitcase full of chestnut pure and an excellent looking pt). It's been a magical weekend! @anthonysantospirito
Hot chocolate, pastries and watching the world go by. Can't think of a more heavenly way to spend a Sunday
Sunday stroll through the colonnades of Le Palais Royal, enjoying the last, precious rays of summer sunshine

Such a treat to be waking up in Paris this morning on a surprise weekend away organised by @anthonysantospirito to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Chocolat chaud and baguette for breakfast, terrine and (the most amazing) chocolate mousse for dinner last night - I'm in heaven

Going through photos from our holiday in Puglia to put together in a blog post. And dreaming of this stunning piazza that we stumbled upon on the tiny town of Galatina. And the almond granita that we had in the little caf there

Lovely, sweet Scottish langoustines for dinner tonight - lightly poached, with heaps of olive oil, parsley and lemon juice. Such a simple dish to cook, but such a treat to eat! Thank you @jamieoliver the culinary inspiration (and for a delicious lunch
Couldn't resist making 'Crostatine di Prugne Dolci e Mascarpone' (sweet plum and mascarpone tartlets) for dessert
Sometimes the simplest of foods are all you want to eat. Like a plump roast chicken with crispy, salty skin @anthonysantospirito

Heavenly long lunch with the loveliest of friends, who came bearing a freshly baked cinnamon plum cake (so we tucked into two desserts!) and pretty pink flowers (which are now sitting in a vase on my bedside table). @bruceoldfield @jo_rodgers @subtlegoose @romilly_mca
Chocolate chestnut meringue pie straight out of the oven (all lovely and browned on top, just as I like it!) and waiting for friends to arrive for lunch
My little kitchen assistant (still in his pyjamas!) helping me out with the making of a honey roasted plum pavlova
Figs and plums and wine. Enjoying the last of the summer fruits
My latest post is on @food52 with the simplest recipe for homemade bread, and tips for cozy entertaining
Enjoying the last of the summer sunshine with all the other children in the 'campo'. The ancient water well makes for an excellent climbing frame
The very beginnings of supper
Creamy pumpkin soup and freshly baked bread for supper tonight. Something about homemade bread that I always find so satisfying
The makings of a late summer picnic

Spent the morning writing at Caf Florian (can't think of a prettier or more inspiring setting to work in!), then caught up with the loveliest @villailbernocco for a bite to eat. And now I'm enjoying the last of the afternoon sun with my beautiful mother @romilly_mca
It was so foggy first thing this morning, and then the sun came out and the water sparkled

Back home in Venice and it feels as though Autumn is encroaching upon us. The air was thick with fog this morning, and the market is full of plump figs & the last of the late summer plums. I can't help but feel that this kind of weather and this kind of fruit call for some kind of home baked tart

Lunch at 'Il Bastione' in the old town of Gallipoli. The restaurant is perched atop of the rocks looking out on to the open sea. It's all white linen tablecloths, charming waiters and homemade pasta: we settled on 'pacheri' with lobster and baby tomatoes, and 'orecchiette' with turnip tops and clams. Thank you @bellinitravel for the fabulous recommendation
Late afternoon 'aperitivo' with @anthonysantospirito in the marina at Otranto, just watching the world go by and the fishing boats come in
Glorious pastries from Caf Alvino in Lecce. I need to learn how to make these rum baba at home - the sponge is as light as air and they're filled with a wonderful creamy custard

Buongiorno from the lovely old streets of Lecce in Puglia! I'll be taking over the @cntraveler account this weekend with photos and tips from our holiday here in Puglia. Would love if you followed along... Xx

Landed in Puglia from Venice late last night. Stopped off for dinner (maccheroni with scampi, baby tomatoes and almonds followed by an exquisite 'biancomangiare') and went straight to bed. When I woke up this morning, I was happy to find Lecce every bit as charming as I remembered it

Magical dinner in our garden with some of my favourite people to celebrate (finally!) submitting my PhD thesis. Thank you @romilly_mca for an unforgettable night - no one lays the table as prettily as you do
Helping his Mamma pick fruit. Sort of
Thank you @sbsfood for the lovely feature today, showcasing some of my favourite dessert recipes (including this honey, ginger and salted almond semifreddo)! Xx
Lazy stroll with @worldnosh after lunch, while the boys ran around the island. We filled my old straw hat with figs and wild blackberries for us all to eat on the boat ride home
Course after course of the loveliest seafood lunch with @worldnosh and @giuliofrancescodt
New post on 'From My Dining Table': secret islands, childhood memories and a recipe for this 'Crostata di Prugne Dolci e Amaretti' (sweet plum and amaretti tart)! Xx
Rooftop views, bright blue skies and the sound of the bells of San Marco
On our way to breakfast at the Orange Caf (best brioche in Venice - baked fresh every morning). My baby boy is getting too big to carry @anthonysantospirito
Afternoon tea with some of my favourite things, including a yogurt cake still warm from the oven and drenched in icing sugar
Aeneas helping himself to lunch. Scallops on the shell, grilled prawns, baby calamari and all things good @scribbleanddaub
One of my favourite little corners in our neighbourhood. Somehow, it always feels so peaceful here
Still hot from the oven and just in time for afternoon tea
A little Sunday baking. One 'Crostata di Prugne e Amaretti' (plum and amaretto tart) just about ready to go into the oven
Headed into the centre of town this afternoon to run a couple of errands, and ended up going dress shopping with my Mother. Can't think of a lovelier way to spend the day
Tips and tricks for hosting the simplest and loveliest of picnics in my latest column for @food52! Xx
This morning's shop at the Rialto market. I'm going to miss all this beautiful fruit when winter comes
The view on the drive back into town, after a fun day exploring the lagoon in our little boat. Feeling salty, sunburnt and very happy
Hunting for zucchine flowers, figs, plums and other good things in the lagoon. Photo by the loveliest @scribbleanddaub

Exploring the lagoon in our little boat with @scribbleanddaub and her beautiful family. Stopped off for lunch under the shady pergola on the Vignole Island and treated ourselves to the biggest plate of 'Spaghetti all'Astice' (spaghetti with lobster
Beautiful peaches and fresh mint from the garden to make iced cold tea on what feels like it must be the hottest day of the year
Waiting for Papa to pick us up in his boat @anthonysantospirito @scribbleanddaub
Morning tea and leafing through a pile of cookbooks at this beautiful stone table that @jerseyicecreamco built for us
Five of my favourite recipes for cooking with red wine on @food52 today - including these pears poached in red wine syrup, cardamom and cloves

New post on 'From My Dining Table' with stories of boats and islands and the Venetian lagoon... Also, lots of recipes, including these summer vegetable tartes Tatin and butter roasted peaches... Buon Appetito! Xx

Fun day driving around the lagoon in our little boat. We gave Aeneas his first driving lesson, almost ran over a canoeist (!) and ended up at the Cipriani for iced tea and 'gelato al cioccolato' in the late afternoon

The little bakery around the corner makes a 'Focaccia alla Veneziana' (kind of like a panettone but topped with sugar and almonds) that is as light as air- I could (and do) eat it for breakfast lunch and tea
View from a roof terrace in the quiet quarter of Castello. Terracotta tiles and blue skies for as far as the eye can see
Zucchine, Mint and Basil Tarte Tartin straight out of the oven

So many goodies at the market this morning. Have stockpiled on these beautiful zucchine. Am going to deep fry the flowers with ricotta and mint. And thinking of making some kind of frittata or tart with the greens
Days spent playing in the water fountain just round the corner from our house - it's Aeneas' favourite thing to do. Bonus points for splashing his Mamma

Excited to be writing a new column for @food52, with recipes, tips on how to entertain on a large scale, and menu suggestions. My first post is all about why I like to plan dinner parties around dessert (this peach & saffron tart being a current favourite
Strolling through the back streets in the midday sun and stumbled upon this peaceful little corner. Love how the brightly coloured laundry is reflected in the water, kind of like a rainbow
On my way to meet friends for an aperitivo. @charlotte_olympia
Delighting in all the summer fruits: juicy white peaches, golden plums from the Island of Sant'Erasmo, and so many cherries
A quiet lunch in the prettiest dining hall in Venice. @anthonysantospirito
So much beautiful fruit at the market this morning. I came home with baskets full
Aeneas (all of two and a half years old) keeps saying that he wants to ride on a gondola. I don't think that I've been on one since I was about his age

Thank you @smallish_magazine for the loveliest feature in your latest issue. So lovely to see @takeapicturelady's pretty pictures of our family picnic with @courtneyadamo and @lacoquetakids in your pages
A busy (and exciting!) day of meetings in Milan today, but I still found time to browse the shoe section in Corso Como 10 and for afternoon tea with @anddicted

Sharing a bowl of gelato topped with thick chocolate sauce and the most exquisite 'semifreddo di zabaione' with @elizahopps. I can't think of anything more perfectly refreshing to eat on a hot summer's day like today
Escaped the city for the day and enjoying the sea breeze (and the pretty views) from a bridge on Torcello

Watching the fireworks booming and crackling over the rooftops, and then reflected in the Venetian lagoon with @elizahopps, @farmella, @michaellynas, @romilly_mca and @anthonysantospirito. Can't help but ooh and ahh just a little

Standing on a roof terrace and watching the boats gather on the Grand Canal in time for the fireworks at midnight. Completely captivated by the sound of music blaring, horns tooting and water lapping down below

All dressed up and heading out for a fabulous night and some very fabulous fireworks. Every year Venice celebrates the festival of the Redentore with one massive street (and water) party - I think that it's my favourite night of the year
So much beautiful fruit at the market this morning. Have bought a whole bag of lovely white peaches to make peach iced tea

New post on the blog! All about our summer picnic with the loveliest @lacoquetakids, @courtneyadamo and @takeapicturelady. With lots of recipes, including my favourite 'Crostata di Pesche e Zafferano' (Peach & Saffron Tart)! Xx
Strolling around the quieter quarters of town with a nice gelato. It's so gloriously hot today that you can hear the crickets singing in the distance
This red wine cherry and mascarpone tart has fast become one of my favourite recipes. It's just heaven on a hot summer's night
So many beautiful peaches at this time of year. Looking forward to settling in to a little cozy baking this weekend
to when Aeneas tried to break into @lacoquetakids' garden shed! And to a lazy afternoon spent in the sunshine with @lacoquetakids, @courtneyadamo, @takeapicturelady and families
The view on my walk this morning. We had huge storms last night, but by the time I was up and about again today the sun was shining and our neighbours had their laundry out to dry
Thinking about roasting some golden plums with a drizzle of honey to go with dinner tonight

A blissfully hot day spent wandering around the winding back streets with @anthonysantospirito. Then we stopped off at our favourite pasticceria for an iced cold tea and a slice of freshly baked ricotta cake

The weather is so hot today and the air is so close that it feels like it might storm. There are bowls of peaches on our dining table, and heaps of garden roses. Love each and everyone of these little signs of summer
The view on the drive in from the airport. We've had a lovely few days in London, but so happy to be back in Venezia, where the sun is shining and the air feels wonderfully hot

Can't think of a more glorious way to spend a summer's afternoon than sharing a picnic with @lacoquetakids, @courtneyadamo, @takeapicturelady and their beautiful families. Also, I will be taking over @lacoquetakids' Instagram account today - would love if you followed along!! Xx

So much food last night! Roast duck legs, roasted figs and plums marinated in red wine, onion & thyme tart, cous cous and a 'tortino di cioccolato' (flourless chocolate cake) with amaretto peaches to round it off
to when Aeneas tried to climb a tree, and we ended up going home for tea and a slice of cake instead
A glass of wine, a little cheese and a slice or two of salami to tide us over, while I set about cooking dinner
I can't even begin to describe quite how heavenly these roses smell. Thank you @jo_rodgers and @subtlegoose for spoiling me with flowers! Xx
Cappuccino and brioche taken standing at the bar. My second breakfast of the day and a very lovely start to the week

Lazy Sunday lunch with @jo_rodgers, @subtlegoose and @baulfbm. Aeneas pottering around the table, as we gossiped over a bottle of prosecco. And @anthonysantospirito roasting poussin on the barbecue. Couldn't think of a more lovely way to spend the day

Very excited about these beautiful bourbon poached peaches. Cooked to @nigellalawson's recipe (from my very worn and much loved copy of 'Forever Summer') and ready to be served up with a dollop of mascarpone

The remnants of a lovely long lunch with @jerseyicecreamco. We pulled together an impromptu meal of cheese, fruit, salami, wine, tomatoes, a fennel salad. Then we got to chatting and somehow the whole afternoon whiled away
Every time I walk over this little bridge and turn to look to my right, I can't help but think that this is one of the prettiest corners in Venice

New post on 'From My Dining Table' with lots of recipes for you to enjoy! Including these crispy roast duck legs with red wine figs and a 'Torta Allo Yogurt' (yogurt cake) with blackberries and rose water sugar icing, which is an absolute family favourite. Also, fond memories from my schooldays in Venice
to the time we took @anthonysantospirito's little boat out to the Island of Torcello, ate dark chocolate 'gelato' and drank far too many white peach bellinis. We need to do that again this summer
