Afternoon pick-me-up in the form of a freshly baked 'Crostata Di Pesche Al Profumo di Zafferano' (Peach & Saffron Tart) and a little coffee. This is the second time that I've baked this lovely tart this week and it's fast becoming a favourite recipe
Baking with cherries. It's rather a labour of love, cutting out the pips one by one. But then again, it's also kind of therapeutic. And deeply satisfying
Polishing off the last of the red wine pears for dessert at lunch today. Love how they taste richer and more syrup-y the longer they marinate in the wine and spices
Buttered peach & saffron tart just gone into the oven. Something about the smell of peaches caramelising under the hot grill that is just heavenly, and has me all excited about dinner
Peeling pears to slow bake in red wine in the oven. You cook them very gently for about five hours, but they come out so tender and a beautiful deep, dark crimson red
Happy Father's Day to the very best 'Papi' we could ever wish for! @anthonysantospirito Xx
Strawberries and peaches for dessert tonight. Just as is, nothing more. Except maybe a dollop of thick cream
A peaceful Saturday afternoon. Not a car in sight; just rowing boats
So happy with this simple dish for dinner 'a due' tonight: crispy duck legs with red wine roasted figs. And a little fennel salad on the side
There's a bowl of figs that have been marinating in red wine for two days. And I'm going to roast them for dinner with @anthonysantospirito tonight

Honoured to be featured on A Cup Of Jo today with a recipe for Ricotta Ice Cream and Balsamic Strawberries. It's one of my favourite summer recipes and I am so happy to be sharing it with you on @joannagoddard's beautiful blog

Hunting for vases and jars and other receptacles to hold all these beautiful pink roses that @anthonysantospirito bought me for no reason other than because he knows that pink is my favourite colour. And doing so while he roasts seafood and chunks of fennel and asparagus on the barbecue
Enjoying the sunshine, the reflection of the water and the sound of the seagulls circling in the air (photo by @local_milk)
I've been sitting at the little desk in my study writing all day. So, a slice of freshly baked 'Torta Allo Yogurt' (yogurt cake) and a cup of tea feels like just what I need

I feel like I'm Alice in Wonderland when I come here. Something about the roses and the hidden jasmine garden and the little white rabbit hopping around (!) that makes me feel as though I stepping into another (and utterly dreamy) world
Recovering from the most indulgent of Sunday lunches with a little afternoon tea. And indulging my love of all things pretty with delicate pink china teacups and a rose petal tea blend

Still dreaming of last night's dinner: one magically long table laden with peonies and candles and more 'antipasti' than you could possibly imagine. Followed by wild dancing and the prettiest of birthday cakes (think wild berries and flowers and snow white icing). Pretty much all of my favourite things! Thank you @fionajoye and @cultofg including us in such a special evening! Xx

Wrapping up these peonies, putting on my highest of heels and rushing out the door to @cultofg's fabulous birthday dinner chez @fionajoye. So looking forward to it - I have a very soft spot for birthday parties

I'm in London for a few days for work meetings and the @blogtacular event tomorrow. And just finished the loveliest and longest lunch (you know it's a good lunch when it's long) with @priorforhire and @skyegyngell at Skye's stunning restaurant, Spring. Such a magical setting, the most delicious food and the very loveliest of company - thank you both
And then there were butter roasted peaches with caramelised brown sugar and copious, copious quantities of clotted cream... @anthonysantospirito
This might look chaotic, but it is the very beginnings of tonight's dinner. I have never really been a tidy cook
Blue skies, that gentle feeling of the sun warming your skin, and calm waters all the way out on to the open lagoon - that is kind of what Venice is all about at this time of the year

Leafing through old cookbooks and making plans for dinner tonight. Am thinking some variation on the theme of roast chicken, crispy potatoes and a fennel salad of sorts. Maybe a 'vignarola romana' (light spring vegetable soup) to start? Also, I had roasted peaches for dessert last night which was just dreamy - so perhaps I should add that to the menu too

The jasmine at this time of year just smells overwhelmingly good. It brings back memories of the last days of school (the ones just before the start of the holidays when it was all fun and games), picnics on the Lido and pitchers of peach iced tea. Photo by @local_milk
Cooking up these beautiful tomatoes to make a simple 'sugo al pomodoro' (tomato sauce), while chatting and sipping on wine

This view never ceases to take my breath away. If you squint, it almost looks like a painting. We're off to the English countryside this weekend, to visit old friends and (weather permitting) romp through fields and take afternoon tea in the garden. It's a trip that we make round about now every year - so looking forward to it! Hope that you have the loveliest weekend too! Xx

This red wine and strawberry jelly makes me happy - somehow it just tastes as I imagine Summer should taste. Anyhow, it has become my go-to dessert these past few weeks. You can find the recipe on 'From My Dining Table' now along with a few other summer-y dishes and a new post! Xx
to when Aeneas and I wore matching shoes

The loveliest delivery arrived through our postbox today: the latest issue of 'Where Women Cook'. So happy to see my recipes and story all printed up beautifully, but even more surprised and beyond delighted to see myself featured on the cover! Grazie @wherewomencook - I can't wait to curl up on the sofa with your magazine this evening and read it cover to cover! Xx

Barbecued seafood, bread (for soaking up the sauce) and a bottle of cold white wine. Strawberries with whipped rosemary cream still to come. Shared with @anthonysantospirito. Can't think of a happier way to spend this beautiful evening

Morning shop at the Rialto Market. Heaps and heaps of artichokes - the little sweet kind, as well as the big fat ones with the deep purple leaves. I'm making a pasta sauce with them tonight, and thinking of cooking up the leftovers with a little cheese to fill a 'torta salata' (pastry pie

Even though it was grey when I first woke up, it's turned into a beautiful day today - and I'm soaking up the sunshine in the gardens at Locanda Cipriani on Torcello. It's wonderfully peaceful here, a world apart (if only a short boat ride) from the bustling city centre of Venice. I am also sharing my favourite hidden corners of Venice on the @cntraveler Instagram account this weekend if you fancy following along... Xx

Lazy lunch in this quiet little nook with @marte_marie_forsberg. The sun is shining, there is a gentle breeze and we've been sitting here for nigh on 3 hours, eating seafood, sipping cold white wine and catching up on all that there is to catch up on

And if you're looking for tips on where to eat, shop and play while in Venice... I am delighted to be taking over the @cntraveler Instagram account this weekend and sharing some of my favourite off-the-beaten-track spots! Would love it if you followed along with me... Xx
I am excited to be taking over the @stylistmagazine Instagram account today and sharing some of my favourite recipes! Follow along for a few of my go-to summery dishes... Xx

I spent today ambling through the city with @local_milk, taking her to all manner of hidden corners and quirky shops, including the beautiful old chemist in Campo San Polo. The one where they sell lotions and potions in pretty glass bottles, where the floors are made of ancient marble and the old wooden door squeaks as you open it
When the city is buzzing with tourists, I love that our local area still feels quiet and peaceful. That said - it looks like our neighbours are planning on one hell of a party
From the market
Morning cappuccino and brioche with @local_milk at Caf Florian in Piazza San Marco. To the dulcet tones of a pianist playing Tchaikovsky
Fresh jasmine cut from the bush in our garden, sweet Sicilian peaches, almond pastries and a pot of tea
Strolling through the backstreets with @anthonysantospirito, @local_milk, this little man and our dogs

Lunch today with @local_milk and @anthonysantospirito. The best kind of lunch, where they bring you endless plates of 'antipasti' and you drink wine and chat. And before you know it, the whole afternoon has whiled away

Spent today strolling around Venice with @local_milk and @anthonysantospirito. Then stopped off for lunch at one of my favourite 'trattorie' ('gnocchi' with tomato & spider crab, razor clams with polenta and a lemon vodka sorbet to finish off!). Always so happy to have an excuse to explore the hidden corners of this beautiful city
A lovely afternoon spent playing around in the kitchen. Now just waiting for @local_milk to arrive in time for dinner
Ending dinner with a little home made 'gelato' and some strawberries drenched in sugar and balsamic
to when @anthonysantospirito and I pretended we were tourists in Venice with J. Links' beautiful book 'Venice for Pleasure' as our guide
Playing around in the kitchen
The remnants of a lovely dinner with @charlotte_olympia, @bigdaddymac23 and @cultofg. There was roast duck and red wine jelly involved. @lacoquetakids, we missed you! Xx
I am really excited to share my list of must-see and under-the-radar shows at this year's Art Biennale in the Arts & Culture section of @cntraveler! Xx
There is something so relaxing about baking on a Sunday night and these strawberries were just begging to be made into something. So: 'Crostata di Fragole con Crema di Mascarpone
White linen coat and red @lacoquetakids socks
I am in love with this simple artichoke salad. Somehow it just tastes like Spring. Recipe on 'From My Dining Table' now
I can't help but feel that a weekend that starts with a 'Meringata di Cocco' (Coconut Meringue Cake) is going to be a good one

I'm working on lots of exciting projects at the moment and I'm looking for an intern to help me! Do you know anyone who might be interested? It's a paid position that comes with the added bonus of lots of tea and cake. Please email me (skye@frommydiningtable.com) for more details and to apply. Thank you so much - looking forward to hearing from you!! Xx
These little chocolates filled with coffee syrup are a really lovely way to end a meal and a personal favourite of mine. You can find my recipe for them on @food52 now
So, not too sure who I've fallen for more: this handsome little fellow? The hot pink hydrangea? Or the antiques store behind them

Beyond delighted to be listed (alongside @manoloblanhikhq, @beyonce and @sibellacourt!!) as someone to follow on @instagram in the Telegraph Magazine a little while back. Thank you so much @telegraphmag for the feature, thank you @scribbleanddaub for spotting it and thank you @baulfbm for saving me a copy (English papers not so readily available in Venice)! Xx
Delighted to see my list for where to eat and shop and play in Venice during the Art Biennale featured on the @cntraveler site

Sunday feast: cooked by @anthonysantospirito, and eaten in the lovely company of @baulfbm and @sjjustin. Heavenly to catch up with old friends and ever in awe of my husband's cooking skills (barbecued mussels, clams & king prawns with 'salsa verde' - so good!!). PS wishing all you lovely Mammas a happy Mother's Day! Xx
Enjoying the sunshine and going for a walk after a lazy Sunday lunch. Everything is magical at this time of the year

The last few weeks have been a whirlwind and I haven't been able to spend as much time in the kitchen as I would like to. But things are settling back to normal now and I've finally got round to writing up a new post with a few simple Spring recipes, including these 'puncetti' (chocolate, almond and rum truffles - so good!). Hope you like them (link in profile)... Xx

'I don't feel very much like Pooh today' said Pooh. 'There there,' said Piglet. 'I'll bring you some tea and honey until you do.' @kirstenrickert has a beautiful post about the healing properties of honey (link in @kirstenrickert's profile) on her site today, which I am delighted to have contributed to
to this lovely, fresh breakfast at @sundaysuppers' studio in Brooklyn. Sitting at home now, writing up a blog post and craving that sweet melon and those stunning views over the city
It's been a crazy busy (and very fun) few days with lots of friends in town for the Biennale, but tonight I am indulging in a quiet night in. With cake, a good book and a cup of tea
Venice - usually so quiet and sleepy - is buzzing right now for the opening of the Contemporary Art Biennale. So much fun seeing the city full of talented and creative people
Not all too much left of dessert from lunch today: 'puncetti' (chocolate, almond and rum truffles), golden plums and sweet wine

Sunday lunch sitting in the shade and looking out on to the lagoon at @hotelcipriani with @anthonysantospirito, @romilly_mca and @farmella. Feeling very lucky to be in such lovely company and such a magical setting
Trimming artichokes for lunch

I had so much fun in NYC these past few days - catching up with friends, a little bit of work and a lot of eating out at fabulous restaurants - but it's nice to be home. And so nice to be greeted by this little smiley face

Thank you @huffposttaste for featuring my recipe for Chilled Cream of Asparagus & Nutmeg Soup in a piece about how to cook white asparagus. I'm looking forward to trying some of the other featured recipes, starting with @mimithor's Gratin with Bchamel and @phoebelapine's Herby Sabayon Sauce

So looking forward to hosting a photography, cooking and writing retreat with the beautiful and talented @marte_marie_forsberg in this beautiful palazzo on the Grand Canal in Venice this October. Four days of cooking and eating and exploring the hidden corners of the city. For more information and to book tickets follow the link in @marte_marie_forsberg's profile (only a couple of places left!) or feel free to email me with any questions

At home in Venice, I usually stop off at a couple of different coffee shops for more than one breakfast. I couldn't resist doing the same here in New York. So: cortado and chocolate chip cookie at @ostcafe
A lazy breakfast at @buvettenyc with the lovely @lkobrin - such a cozy spot, THE most delicious eggs (so good!) and all round a pretty perfect way to start the week
The makings of lunch in @sundaysuppers' light bathed kitchen
Taking my @charlotte_olympia shoes out on the town for drinks at the very fabulous @wythehotel with @lkobrin and @cannellevanille
Sitting down to lunch in @sundaysuppers' beautiful studio with the lovely @cannellevanille
to when Aeneas helped me with dinner
Ciao Venezia! Sitting at the airport waiting to board my flight to NYC. Hoping for bright blue skies and sunshine there too
Spent such a lovely day playing in the kitchen, sipping tea and chatting with @portlandfresh. And now there is a beautiful 'Torta Allo Yogurt' sitting on my countertop, just begging to be eaten

Somehow, am rushed off my feet trying to tie up loose ends before I fly to New York on Wednesday. No time to cook supper, so have settled on a slice of leftover cake and am calling it dinner. Feeling quite happy about that. PS do you have any recommendations for my time in NY? Places to eat and shop and fabulous things to see? Thank you so much! Xx
Weekend baking from @violetcakeslondon's beautiful new cookbook. In love with this recipe for almond & summer fruit cake with rose scented icing

Just finishing up a lazy lunch with @phoebevujcic, @danvujcic and their two beautiful girls. Love few things more than cooking for friends and an excuse to spend time in their delicious company. Also, exciting news: first new potatoes of the season (served with lemon and parsley, of course

One of the things that I love most about Spring is eating 'al fresco' in the garden. New post the blog with a few light Spring recipes, including this 'frittata' with 'bruscandoli e pecorino' (wild hops & pecorino cheese - a Venetian classic!) and tartlets with wild strawberries & whipped ricotta. Have a lovely weekend
I've lived here for most of my life and know the city like the back of my hand, but sometimes I still manage to get lost
Bounty from the Rialto Market. Now, what should I cook
Grocery shopping at the market and looking on to this
Lunch that turned into afternoon tea. And ended with a Genoese sponge cake
Pretty much the perfect way to end dinner: with whipped ricotta and wild strawberries
First day without a jacket. Spring has officially arrived in Venice
Lazy start to the day with soft boiled eggs, crusty bread
Late afternoon stroll and came across this cheerful little fellow
Lemons from our garden. Thinking of making limoncello

We're home in Venice again, after a few wonderfully relaxing days visiting friends in the countryside in Lombardia. Now that I'm back in the kitchen, I'm making this 'tortino di cioccolato' (flourless chocolate cake) with rosemary whipped cream. Recipe on the blog and on @stellerstories
One of those leisurely lunches that linger on and on. What a perfect way to spend Easter Sunday
A lazy breakfast of eggs (of course!) and now we're heading out into the garden for an Easter egg hunt. Wishing everyone a very Happy Easter - hope that you're all having a lovely day!! Xx

Shopping at the Rialto Market for our Easter lunch tomorrow: half a goat for roasting, puntarella, wild asparagus and, of course, plenty of artichokes. Walking over to the bakery to collect our 'colomba' (Easter cake) now
Walking through St Marks Sq with @anthonysantospirito on our way for dinner at Harry's Bar with the lovely @clairesclifton
Leafing through the latest (& gorgeous) issue of @thoughtfullymagazine... And delighted to see my recipe for 'Risotto alla Primavera' (spring vegetable risotto) featured. Thank you!! Xx
All dressed up, wearing my pretty new flats and waiting for my boat ride
Lazy breakfast in the garden, followed by a catch-up with @neumarc and @ezgipolat. We sat by the waterside, soaking up the sunshine and gossiped the morning away. Really feels like Spring is here
Treating myself to a second breakfast at Caff Florian this morning: brioche, hot chocolate and one of the prettiest dining rooms in town
An homage to white asparagus, a recipe for coconut cream meringue cake (so good!) and some exciting news on 'From My Dining Table' now
Monday morning cappuccino with @lkobrin and @hulyaozkurt. The sun is shining and I'm feeling good about this week... (Photo by @lkobrin

Leisurely lunch at one of my favourite restaurants, sitting outside, soaking up the sunshine and in the company of the lovely @lkobrin. Pretty much a perfect Sunday. @anthonysantospirito we missed you
A cozy night in with this white asparagus and Taleggio cheese lasagne

I am going completely wild for white asparagus at the moment, cooking and eating them every which way. But theirs is such a short season and they're just so very delicious, that I can't really help myself
to when Aeneas wore his dapper 'grandpa' cardigan (from @lacoquetakids) and gave me a pretty bunch of mimosa

Beyond excited to announce that I will be hosting a four day photography, cooking and writing retreat with the lovely and wonderfully talented @marte_marie_forsberg here in Venice this October (20th-25th). We'll be based in an enchanting, ancient palazzo on the Grand Canal, looking on to this pretty view (honestly, one of my favourite views in town!). For more details or to book a spot, head to www.mmforsberg.bigcartel.com or follow the link in @marte_marie_forsberg's profile
Aeneas and I are having a 'special' supper together tonight: white asparagus dipped like soldiers into 'salsa all'uovo' (egg and olive oil sauce) for dinner tonight
Lazy afternoon tea and a long overdue catch-up with friends. Pretty much the perfect way to spend a Saturday afternoon
to a quiet morning spent in this beautiful palazzo sipping tea, nibbling on sweet cakes and gossiping with the lovely @marte_marie_forsberg

The lovely @oakwoodinspiration asked me to make a 'healthy' cake for her birthday celebrations tonight and I wasn't too sure what to do... So have settled on three tiers of meringue with coconut cream, flaked almonds and forest fruits
I made an orange blossom scented 'Mimosa Cake' to celebrate 'La Festa Delle Donne' (Ladies' Day) on the 8th March. The recipe (along with a few other treats) is on 'From My Dining Table' now
I've traded in my winer coat for a light jacket, I can hear the sound of birds first thing in the morning and I'm having asparagus for dinner: is it fair to call it Spring yet
We ate this for dessert yesterday and it was so good that I couldn't resist making it again for dinner tonight: crushed meringues with whipped mascarpone cream and strawberries
We walk past this little corner every morning on our way to breakfast at our local caf. I always think it has a kind of mysterious charm about it

I've been rushing around like a crazy person all day and for once, I just didn't feel like cooking dinner. So I'm curling up with a good book, a cup of tea and a very lovely slice of 'Torta di Mimosa al Profumo di Fior D'Arancio' (Orange Blossom Scented Mimosa Cake
to a winter's day spent wandering through the vineyards on the sleepy island of Mazzorbo
The whole house smells like mimosa. It's a small thing, but it makes me so very happy
I've just added a new page to my site with a list of all my favourite places to eat, to shop and to while away the afternoon. If you're planning a visit to Venice anytime soon, take a peek... Xx
Asparagus with 'Zabaione' sauce for dinner tonight. Because it's almost Spring. And because I felt like a treat
A cozy supper for two tonight: saffron & lemon risotto, pan fried pork chops with sage and a lovely chicory salad. Can't think of a nicer way to end the weekend

Such a beautiful bunch of bright yellow mimosa from @anthonysantospirito this morning to celebrate 'la festa delle donne' (Ladies' Day). Feeling very happy and spoilt right now, and wishing all you lovely ladies a happy day too!! Xx
Such a cozy dinner last night with the lovely @jo_rodgers and @subtlegoose - eating and drinking and chatting into the late hours of the night/early hours of the morning
Baking a blood orange & rosemary tart for dinner tonight
The last of the winter fruits

This is my favourite way to cook duck: I stuff the bird with pears and grapes, then roast it all together in a really hot oven so that the skin gets wonderfully crispy and the fruit becomes soft and sweet. The recipe is on From My Dining Table now in case it takes your fancy... Along with my musings on apple tart and Ernest Hemingway
'Crostata Di Strudel' (apple, pear and raisin pie), sweet tea and some very lovely company all together make for a pretty perfect afternoon
A deliciously peaceful view on to the Grand Canal
Baking aftermath. And something smells good in the oven
Came home from the market with armfuls of flowers
A late and leisurely lunch that sort of turned into an early dinner. I'm now on my second helping of pappardelle with duck rag...and we've still got dessert to go
Afternoon tea for one. With book
Even though I've lived in Venice for as long as I can remember, I still sometimes get lost in the winding alleys (photo by the lovely @marte_marie_forsberg
Baking little mascarpone and red currant tarts for dessert tonight

I've spent the past few weeks complaining about the cold and the wind and the winter that never seems to end. So much so that I've begun to bore even myself. But now that I've spotted daffodils at the shops, and the days have started to grow longer, it feels like spring is really and truly almost here

Chatting about hopes, dreams and exciting plans with the loveliest @marte_marie_forsberg. Over warming tea and freshly baked brioche (still piping hot from the oven!). In what has to be one of the prettiest rooms in Venice

Is there such a thing as eating too many sweets?? Today, @marte_marie_forsberg and I have indulged in 'fritelle' (Venetian doughnuts), 'focaccia Veneziana' (sugared almond cake), 'cannoli Siciliani' and then topped it all off with Zabaione & Amaretti biscuits

And then the sun came out... This morning was so foggy, I could barely see beyond the tip of my nose. But then it turned into the most beautiful day and I can't think of a nicer way to have spent it than wandering around the city and eating (far too much) delicious food with the beautiful @marte_marie_forsberg

I can never resist the 'Torta Allo Zabaione' (zabaione cake) when we go for lunch at Harry's Bar in Venice. So I tried making something similar at home, added a pinch of saffron to the custard and a little rose water to the sponge. So happy with the result! The recipe is on 'From My Dining Table' now
There is such a wonderful atmosphere in Venice at the moment with the Carneval - I love seeing everyone dressed up
Wishing all you very lovely people a happy Valentines Day!! Xx
Love leftovers
Now, that is a front door with style
Excited about dinner tonight. @anthonysantospirito is roasting a chicken and I made this 'crostata al cioccolato e rosmarino' (dark chocolate and sweet rosemary tart
Baking makes me happy
Just published a new post on From My Dining Table... With all manner of recipes, including a red wine risotto and this rose & saffron scented 'Torta Allo Zabaglione' (zabaglione sponge cake)... Xx
I never quite tire of this view
Loving this month's edition of @vanityfair and so excited to have contributed a piece on my favourite restaurants in Venice to the 'On Travel' section
Excited about tonight's dessert - 'Torta Allo Zabaglione Al Profumo di Zafferano e Rose' (Rose and Saffron Scented Zabaglione Cake
The sun is setting a little later every day, and the days are getting that tiny bit longer. Feels like winter is almost over and spring is almost with us
It's so cold out tonight and it's been such a crazy busy week, that I'm curling up on the sofa with a cup of tea, a Nancy Mitford novel and drifting off into my own little dream world
Now, I kind of want to paint my house blue too
'Torta Al Limone' (lemon sponge cake) for tea today & Aeneas helped me bake it
If doors could talk, these two would have a lot of stories to tell
When Monday starts with brioche and black cherry jam on vintage China plates, you know that the week is off to a good start
Fruits of a weekend baking. There's nothing like a good 'crostata di Mele' (Apple tart) to stave off Sunday night blues

Curled up at home, sifting through photos from a few Sundays ago, when @anthonysantospirito and I made a trip to the island of Mazzorbo. It's a magical little island and I'm still dreaming about the exquisitely good duck we ate there (it was wild duck from the surrounding lagoon). I would love to put together a post about it on From My Dining Table, but need to perfect the recipe for 'Tagliatelle con Anatra' (tagliatelle with wild duck and white wine sauce) first

I'm taking this frosty weather as an excuse to hole up in the kitchen and bake. Making a favourite recipe for 'Crostata di Mele con Rosa e Timo' (apple, rose & thyme tart) and just loving how it smells in my oven
I'm spending the day at home today, locking myself in and working to a deadline. Still - I couldn't help but take a little break to enjoy these beautiful spring flowers
I kind of love how in Venice everyone knows everyone's business, down to the colour of your undergarments. There is something rather comforting about it

New post on From My Dining Table! Playing house in a Venetian palazzo, making new & beautiful friends and the recipe for this 'Tortino di Cioccolato con Crema al Rosmarino' (flourless chocolate cake with rosemary cream), my most favourite and the most decadent cake I have ever baked
Distressed pastels
Taking a quick break from writing with a cup of tea, a biscuit and some classic reading

Love these pastel hues, feels like the whisper of Spring that must be coming soon. Enjoying a lazy Sunday afternoon today and looking forward to a cozy supper with @elizahopps tonight - @anthonysantospirito is making us his special pizza with Asiago cheese, zucchine and fresh mint. Hope that you're all having a lovely weekend too! Xx
Legend has it that Napoleon called Piazza San Marco the drawing room of Europe. I think of that every time I walk through it. Funny the things that stick in your mind
Fighting the cold with fresh ginger tea. It's just hot water infused with a few slices of root ginger and a dollop of honey, but it tastes like liquid gold
The makings of a good plate of pasta
to a cold morning at the Rialto market
I can't stop nibbling on this 'Focaccia Veneziana alla Cioccolata'. So I'm just going to call it dinner
Bella mimosa! Cheering me up no end on a dark winter's day

Just in case you missed it, recipes for all manner of Venetian 'cichetti' on From My Dining Table now. Including my favourite 'crostini con lardo, miele e rosmarino' (crostini with lardo, honey & rosemary) & 'insalata di radicchio e nocciola' (radicchio & hazelnut salad
Dessert is my favourite thing about lunch
Risotto is one of my all-time favourite comfort foods. I made a promise to be healthier this year, so I have added vegetables
These old walls and stones have so many stories to tell
Almost too pretty to eat. Almost
We had such a leisurely, indulgent lunch today that I thought I might never eat again. Then, I made meringues and proved myself wrong
Laundry day
It's cold and raining outside, so I'm curling up with a warming cup of @marbleandmilkweed tea and a good book
If only there were a way of capturing how sweet these pretty blooms smell... Thank you @anthonysantospirito for spoiling me! Xx
Afternoon stroll in the winter sunshine
Quiet moment. Quiet corner
Running myself a nice, hot bath and filling it with delicate @ederleshop bath salts. Thank you for my little gift, @joanneheckadon - so thoughtful of you

Winding down now that all our guests have left. @ginnybranch, @local_milk, @studio_neon and @sonadora_handmade I have had the best time working with you all - wish you could all just stay in Venice forever! Xx
Making pasta with @ashtonlsaunders, @local_milk, @ginnybranch, @sonadora_handmade and @studio_neon. Beautiful recipe cards by @signoraemare
Early morning walk through thick fog with @local_milk, @ginnybranch, @sonadora_handmade and @studio_neon
Winter sunshine and winter fruits
Sweet rose petal tea and thick, dark hot chocolate with @local_milk, @ginnybranch, @sonadora_handmade and @studio_neon
Dinner last night. Thank you @studio_neon, @ginnybranch, @local_milk, @sonadora_handmade and to all the lovely ladies around the table! I had a wonderful time! Xx

Love how empty and quiet the streets of Venice are first thing in the morning. Walking around with @ginnybranch, @sonadora_handmade, @local_milk and @studio_neon and it feels like we're the only ones here
Taking inspiration from simple things

The sun setting on another beautiful day spent cooking, exploring and laughing with @local_milk, @sonadora_handmade, @ginnybranch and @studio_neon. Can't tell you how much fun it is having you all here in Venice! Xx
Where peace reigns
Shopping at the markets and running all manner of errands around town with @local_milk, @ginnybranch, @sonadora_handmade and @studio_neon. So much to do before our guests arrive tomorrow
Just published a new post on From My Dining Table with the recipe for this panettone filled with gelato di marzipane and all sorts of other Venetian goodies
The simplest of food and the very best of company. Seafood lunch with @local_milk, @sonadora_handmade, @studio_neon and @anthonysantospirito
The last touches to brighten up our guest rooms. Welcome to Venice @local_milk, @sonadora_handmade and @studio_neon - so excited to see you guys! Xx
Cappuccino date with @annawatsoncarl at one of the prettiest spots in town. So loved meeting you - and excited to watch all your adventures in Sicily unfold over the next few weeks... Xx
Starting just as we plan to go on - welcoming the new year with friends, food & wine

Stumbled upon this quiet and peaceful corner while exploring the city with @neumarc, @framboisejam, @anddicted and @psychodreaming. I must have walked past these stairs a thousand times over the years, but never once noticed them before. Loved spending the day with you guys - and seeing Venice through your eyes. Thank you! Xx Photo by the insanely talented @neumarc
Breakfast at one of the dreamiest spots in Venice, Caff Florian, with the lovely @anddicted, @framboisejam and @anthonysantospirito - perfect start to the year
Savouring those moments just before the sun set on 2014 for one last time. Happy new year, everyone! Xx
Found some beautiful radicchio di Sant'Erasmo at the market today - and bought it by the armload. It's just heavenly with a light anchovy dressing and a few toasted hazelnuts

Such a magical day strolling around Venice with @anddicted, @framboisejam, @neumarc and @anthonysantospirito. Loved having an excuse to explore hidden corners of the city. And so happy to have made three such truly lovely new friends
Tea with the lovely @worldnosh and @giuliofrancescodt. Two kinds of freshly baked 'Focaccia Veneziana' from our local bakery. Because how can you choose between chocolate and sugared almond
We came across this wild winter jasmine growing up a wall and just had to pick some. It smells so sweet, like summer
Last night it snowed. But by the time we woke up this morning, it had all melted away
It's so cold and dark outside. Snuggled up at home with a marzipan covered panettone, waiting for friends to arrive. @giuliofrancescodt @worldnosh let's get this party started
Lingering over coffee
Bundled up warm and going for a long walk through the city

Laying the table for dinner is one of my favourite Christmas rituals. Happy Christmas and lots of festive love - hope that you're all having a magical day and being spoiled rotten by your loved ones! Xx
House filled with decorations. Presents wrapped and under the tree. Stockings laid out waiting for Father Christmas. It's Christmas Eve and we're heading out to celebrate with friends. Buon Natale

It's starting to feel a lot like Christmas... New post on 'From My Dining Table' now to wish everyone the very happiest of Christmases! With lots of festive recipes, including this 'Carpaccio di Branzino' (Sea Bass Carpaccio) and 'Crespelle con Tartufo e Burrata' (Savoury Pancakes with Burrata and Truffles)... Because, 'tis the season! Xx
Every year I make these Christmas cakes to give as special presents to friends. This year, I made one extra for us too
Shopping for our Christmas feast at the Rialto market, looking out on the buildings clouded in thick fog, and feeling very happy
It's always such a treat receiving letters by post - and so many lovely Christmas cards this year from so many lovely friends. Thank you!! Xx
Whiled away today just playing around in the kitchen. White chocolate, sugared rose petals and silver balls everywhere
Sunday morning baking
Feels like the start of Christmas today. So we're having mince pies for tea
Dinner by candlelight
Just in case you missed it, my recipe for 'certosino' (honeyed fruit & nut cake - an Italian Christmas cake of sorts) is up on From My Dining Table now. Enjoy Xx
Tonight is a much needed cozy night at home for me - wrapping presents and singing along to Christmas carols
So peaceful

Chocolate dessert in the making... My recipe for 'Tronchetto di Natale' (Yule Log with Sweet Chestnut and Italian Meringue Frosting) along with a lovely feature on @jetandindigo's beautiful site today. Xx
Cooking with pomegranates - one of my favourites at this time of year. Photo by the lovely @safau
Little bundles of festive cheer
These snowflake sugar biscuits are a beautiful close to an indulgent Sunday lunch. Thank you @jetandindigo for treating us! Xx
Adding little sugar mushrooms to a 'Tronchetto di Natale' (Chocolate Yule Log) before heading out to a party. Bring the cake with us, of course. See you soon @matthewstadlen! Xx

You can find my recipe for 'putizza' (sweet bread filled with chocolate, rum, raisins, nuts, tarragon and all things good) on the @designsponge site today. Weeknight supper
Distressed
Sugary tea, a good book, sweet tangerines - the kind that leave that wonderful orange-y smell on your fingers - and a bowl of nuts

New post! All about Thanksgiving in Venice. With recipes for this 'Torta Salata con Gorgonzola e Pere' (pear & Gorgonzola pie) and 'Porri Al Latte Gratinati' (leeks lightly cooked in milk with Parmesan & thyme gratin)...and other good things... Xx
Vin brule'. Because 'tis the season

I cooked this for Sunday lunch with friends and have made it three times again since. Leeks lightly cooked in milk and then roasted with a gratin of breadcrumbs and parmigiano. Too good. Recipe up on From My Dining Table very soon

Excited to be featured on Annette Joseph's beautiful site today, with a recipe for 'certosino' (Honey, Chocolate and Nut Fruitcake) - one of my favourites at this time of year. You can find the link on @annettejosephstyle's profile. Grazie, Annette! Xx

Sunday brunch. And then on to decorating the Christmas tree
Doors look prettier with wreathes on them
Buongiorno! Baking bread this morning. Can't think of a better start to the weekend

Cooking lunch: 'porri al latte gratinati con timo' (leeks cooked in milk and baked with breadcrumbs and thyme) - sheer comfort food. Not on show: all the cream, butter and parmigiano that makes lunch so very delicious and so delightfully comforting
Late night baking
It's so cold day today. Creamy pumpkin soup weather, methinks
Palazzo detail
If only there were a way of conveying quite how sweet these pretty yellow flowers smell

Pastel pinks and crumbling bricks. All so very romantic. Also, talking of romantic... the lovely @annettejosephstyle is hosting a workshop in Marrakech next February - you can sign up on her website (link in her profile). All too dreamy for words and top of my Christmas list! Xx
Catching up on some long overdue correspondence
Lingering over coffee. Love Sunday lunches that never end

The aftermath

And that's a wrap. Have a great weekend! Xx
Windows and rickety old shutters. Kind of charming
Celebrating with pie. A nice 'Crostata Di Pere e Castagna', Sweet Chestnut and Pear Pie. Happy Thanksgiving! Xx
Table laid. Dinner roasting in the oven

Aeneas and I baked this cake together. It's a 'torta allo yogurt' with caraway, fennel seeds & candied orange peel. Then - once we were done with all the cooking (and the mess making), we ate it for tea
Because chic beiges and soft greys are all well and good. But sometimes you just need a bit of colour
On the table for dinner tonight: a 'Torta Salata' (savoury pie) with Gorgonzola, pears and prosciutto. And really crumbly pastry
I love how pomegranate seeds sparkle. Like little red rubies
Sunday evening comfort baking. Making 'cotognata'. With quinces and tons of sugar
Once upon a time, it was summer and the sun was shining... Today it's so rainy and cold - I'm dreaming of long Sunday lunches by the waterside
One of my favourite things about this time of year are the chestnuts. Roasting some tonight
Cooking 'alla Francese' tonight. I made this dreamy pie with potatoes, Comte cheese & fresh thyme, to @mimithor's enchanting recipe. Bravissimi, @mimithor and @oddthor - your book is beautiful
Seashells and ivory towers. Just published a new post on From Dining Table. With recipes for fast food - like these scallops on the shell with breadcrumbs, butter & thyme

Proper comfort food for supper tonight: scampi in saor & bread to soak up the juices
Bridge over still water

Plenty

Scallops for dinner. On the shell with breadcrumbs, thyme and more butter than can be good for you. So good

Today has been manic, but coming home to this vase of overblown roses on the little table by our hall made me happy. Very happy
When autumn meets winter
Gold Hill, Shaftesbury. Where peace and tranquility reign. And everything is bathed in a soft, golden light

Spent today playing in the kitchen with the lovely @marte_marie_forsberg and @inglesita. Such a treat to spend time with two gorgeous new friends. Thank you @marte_marie_forsberg for having us in your magical little cottage
Wrapping up a small gift for a friend who has just had a gorgeous little baby girl. Any excuse to buy a pretty dress with a Peter Pan collar
Filling the house with flowers. Just because

Monday morning. And still dreaming of our little trip to Copenhagen last week. One blissful blur of colourful houses, cobbled streets, quiet canals, reindeer moss & forest ants

Decorating cakes for teatime and getting ready to party
Because it's Friday night
Excited and honoured to see my guide to Venice featured on one of my most favourite sites @designsponge today! Head on over there for all the best hidden spots to eat, sleep and shop...Xx

Brought this heavenly black truffle Savarin cheese in Paris yesterday. Now I'm at home, eating it on crusty bread and dreaming of dappled autumn sunshine, lunch at Hotel Costes, the marche' des oiseaux and red woollen berets. New post on From My Dining Table now with this 'Tortino Di Castagne, Cacao e Rosmarino' (Flourless Chocolate, Chestnut & Rosemary cake). And all manner of other autumn comfort food recipes! Have a great week! Xx
Staving off Monday morning blues with the memory of this golden light
Cooking with mushrooms. Ideas, anyone
Cold weather calls for chunky hot soup. With cavolo nero and black eyed beans
to this dreamy kitchen scene
Persimmons for dessert. Just love how that rolls off the tongue: 'per-sim-mons'. Has a sort of musical ring to it. And they're decadently sweet too

Houses, bridges and water. Canary yellows and pastel pinks. There's no other place quite like home
Baby artichokes for supper. Lightly boiled, and doused in olive oil and chopped parsley

Cooking with the fruits of the sea: mussels, seaweed, dilisk butter and all things salty and good

Heading back to Venice today, but still dreaming of this Irish Tea Brack sitting on a quiet window sill. Thank you @modernfarmette @susanspungen @local_milk and @breaking_eggs for a beautiful few days. Xx

Golden leaves, rolling hills and the gentle sound of water. I've arrived in Ireland. It's a dream

New post on From My Dining Table now. With the recipe for this pear, blackberry & hazelnut 'crostata'; and recipes for a chocolate tart and an apple, rose & thyme tart. Basically, it's all about sweet tarts. And Venice. and wabi sabi. Xx

Sending out invitations to Aeneas' second birthday party. Each one lovingly - and beautifully - hand drawn by the insanely talented @scribbleanddaub. With a Wizard of Oz theme, because every birthday party needs a good theme. And because it has been a lifelong ambition of mine to make an Emerald City Cake

Last night. At one long table, laden with flickering beeswax candles. In an artist's breathtaking studio - all high ceilings and the softest golden light. Feasting on the most delicious of food. Thank you @kinfolk @tassjagarner @cottagefarm and @jessicamasonsculpture for a magical evening! Xx
Honoured to be featured on La Coqueta Mums in Style, in a gorgeous post all about baking, shoes and, of course, divinely chic childrenswear. Thank @celialacoquetakids

Buongiorno! A spot of breakfast and leafing through @cherrybombemag. I'm head over heels in love with this magazine - even its pages feel beautiful. Also, tea from @marbleandmilkweed - another newfound obsession

Found these at a flea market. Fell in love with how they were hung
Leftovers for breakfast. The best kind of breakfast
Afternoon tea: crostata di pere con more e nocciole (pear, blackberry & hazelnut pie). Still warm from the oven
It's Monday morning. And I find myself missing this golden light and those enchanted still waters
Golden pears, buttercup cheese and gilded bowls at Hendy's in Hastings

Glorious lunch with the super stylish @scribbleanddaub and her lovely family at Hendy's in Hastings. We ate sweet crab claws, fish bouillabaisse and picked pears until we could eat no more. And I'm in love with every last little darkened corner of this crumbling Georgian building.
Playing with pretty pink flowers. It's so sunny here at the moment that it almost feels like summer. So excited to be spending this sunny weekend in the countryside with the lovely @scribbleanddaub
Lunch: bread, olives, salumi. The simple pleasures in life

New post on From My Dining Table now! Celebrating Autumn and grape picking with three of my favourite recipes, including these 'crostatine di uva fragola' (miniature Concord grape tarts)...and a new little autumnal illustration by the lovely @scribbleanddaub... Enjoy! Xx

Frolicking in the Autumn leaves. Loving these last few days of sunshine with the golden leaves and all. And loving Aeneas' new fall wardrobe from my favourite little shop, La Coqueta Kids. @celialacoquetakids when are you going to start making clothes for grown ups

Some people are happy to go without dessert. I'm not one of those people. Case in point: 'Tortino di Cioccolato Fondente con Amaretti e Timo' (Dark Chocolate Tart with Amaretti and Thyme). Recipe coming soon
Old door. Golden, autumn hues. Rust. Rot. And still beautiful
Working late tonight. A simple supper of bread, pears, Gorgonzola & walnuts to keep me going

New story on Steller! A collection of Autumn recipes & kitchen vignettes, inspired by the five senses - including baked apples with amaretti & candied peel, and grape, fennel & rosemary focaccia. Xx @stellerstories
Dreaming of a late evening aperitivo in Venice. 'Cichetti' & spritz, taken perched on a stone wall, just by the water and watching the sun go down

Morning tea. After a decadently long summer in Venice, I'm settling back into our home in London. Today I'm spring cleaning (even though it's autumn), catching up with all those bits & bobs that I've been ignoring for too long, and just generally nesting. Oh, and treating myself to a cup of @marbleandmilkweed's sweet rose & chamomile tea. It literally tastes like a cup of serenity

There's something so comforting about a bowl of hot soup. When there's a chill in the air and the evenings have become dark, it sort of gives you an almost magical warm glow on the inside. Tonight we're having a zuppa di zucca (pumpkin soup) with crumbled amaretti biscuits on top

There are just a couple of spots left for the photography & styling workshop with @local_milk, @ginnybranch and me, this winter. In Venice. Staying at this palazzo - with its faded Renaissance frescoes, sparkling glass chandeliers and all. January 8th-12th. Book now at localmilkretreats.squarespace.com to join us! Can't wait

Running hideously late. Stuck in a cab in London rush hour traffic. Not that I'm not enjoying the driver's musings and grumblings, but actually feeling kind of flustered and really rather wishing that I were still strolling through these peaceful streets
The house numbering system in Venice is just too good. As is this fire truck red
Autumn is here...with its golden muted colours and all. @hucklegoose is celebrating with - use the code INSTAPOTLUCK to get a 50% discount on their dreamy seasonal meal plans
Ciao Venezia! Sad to say farewell, but we'll be back very soon
Apple tart - with rose petal jam and fresh thyme - ready to go in the oven
Still dreaming of afternoon tea in a crumbling palazzo - where the tables are worn and antique, and the walls are wonderfully faded and ornate. All too romantic for words
Buongiorno
A window looking on to the past
Heavenly, heavenly lunch with the lovely @lkobrin. Sitting under a golden chandelier. Looking onto the water. In one of the most serene & ephemeral spots in Venice
Santa Lucia pears. The start of the season
White skies. Autumn leaves @lkobrin
Buongiorno, Venezia! Spending today ambling around the city, exploring it's hidden corners, drinking coffee and eating 'pasticcini' with @lkobrin! Can't wait
One of the things that I love about baking at the crack of dawn is eating cake, still warm from the oven, for morning tea

So excited to announce a photography & styling workshop here in Venice: this January, when the city deserted and clouded in mist; hosted by @local_milk, @ginnybranch and myself; in an otherworldly palazzo that looks on the the Grand Canal. Literally. Cannot. Wait. If you would like the option to reserve a ticket during our pre-sale later this week, please drop Beth an email on localmilkblog at gmail.com! Xx
Feels like Summer is sighing her last breath. Sweet figs for breakfast. With a dollop of ricotta, fresh thyme and crusty bread
I kind of love that the magnificent building to the left is the Venice hospital. And the tiny little boat in front of it is the ambulance

Just posted on From My Dining Table. All about the mystical charm of Burano, with it's idyllic rainbow coloured houses. And recipes for 'Fritoin' (Venetian Fried Seafood) and 'Buranelli' (Burano butter biscuits) with lemon zest & fresh rosemary. Xx

Dinner on the rooftops. Eating delicious food in the company of gorgeous friends. Can't think of anywhere that I would rather be right now

Things that I'm going to miss about summer: the long days, the cotton sun dresses and eating gelato in a cone. Things that I love about autumn: porcini. And porcini risotto

I've put together a little collection of recipes - inspired by the fruits growing through the wild gardens of Venice, in these last days of summer. Roasted plums with thyme and ricotta; fennel, aubergine & pinenut ratatouille; peaches in wine and rose water; and more on @stellerstories now. Xx

Spent a magical day on the island of Burano, lazing in the sun and eating sweet biscuits. The houses there are all the colours of the rainbow - I fell in love with this pretty blue cottage.

Legend has it that if you light a candle in the Church of the Redentore today - the third Sunday in July - it will bring health and happiness to you and your loved ones for the coming year... So here goes...

Walking up the steps of the Redentore Church to light a candle on the Feast Day of the Holy Redeemer. Such a special place - this is where @anthonysantospirito and I were married 5 years ago, almost to the day

Yall. Maybe one of the best moments of the last two weeks was dancing around my parents kitchen, singing Islands in the Stream on repeat to their sweet muppet dog Sadie, probably about to laugh or cry or both, not about Kenny Rogers (RIP) but about all of it, how a song can seem so perfect, even when its about something else entirely. Islands In The Stream, LOL, That Is What We Are. I made nettle pesto from the weedy, feral back stretch of their garden. Photographing a plate of food right now feels weird. I wandered my parents yard, attuned to details Id overlooked, and the evening light and threat of rain electrified the air and something about the loneliness of this plate of food matched the shared isolation of this moment. Everything feels weird, and it will for a while
Always say yes to a taco assignment! And lets keep showing up for the places we love. Im not ready to quarantine myself from humanity. Love yall

Hows it going pals? Unintentional break from Instagram. Dont know how long. Felt real good. Led to an opening of space in my brain, with errata like songs I loved 20 years ago and dreams I have at night creeping back into my waking hours. It was a pretty great ride. Ive been maxed out on the anxious overstimulation of media but sometimes it takes a nudge to actually step back. Heres to more room for good accidents. Maybe thats my 2020 resolution

Summers gifts are in every small detail, and that is especially true in the Northwest: these deliciously long evenings where the sky slowly fades into cobalt; the rich, floral air and riot of flowers everywhere, and of course, all of this abundant produce and seafood, like the steelhead trout that anchors this bowl. In partnership with @fredmeyer, where I was able to gather all of these ingredients for a perfect, chill BBQ Grilled Summer Bowl with Green Goddess Dressing For the dressing: 1/2 cup plain non-dairy or Greek yogurt 2 tablespoons olive oil Juice of 1/2 lemon 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar, if youve got it 1/4 cup chopped basil 2 tablespoons chopped flat leaf parsley 2 tablespoons chopped chives 1 tablespoon chopped tarragon Sea salt + freshly cracked black pepper For the bowl: Olive oil 8 ounces Steelhead trout 1 head Romaine lettuce, sliced in half lengthwise 1 ear corn 2 small crookneck squash 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved In a food processor or blender, combine the yogurt, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, herbs, and salt and pepper to taste. Blend until creamy and set aside. Prepare your grill so that the coals are at a nice, medium-high heat. Place the steelhead fillets skin-side down, followed by the corn and the squash. The steelhead should be cooked through in 6-8 minutes, depending on thickness. Turn the corn once or twice. Remove from heat, and slice the corn from the cob. Add the romaine lettuce last; itll only need a couple minutes. In two bowls, divide the ingredients equally. Drizzle with the Green Goddess dressing. Enjoy!

The GIVEAWAY for a copy of my cookbook, VIBRANT FOOD, ends tomorrow at midnight PST! [C L O S E D] . Wanna know something? This cake was its own epic fail. Workshop Announcement!! Friends, I'm thrilled to announce that @ful.filled and I are co-teaching a dynamic Food Photography and Styling Workshop in San Francisco! There will be a welcome dinner Friday night & then 2 days of immersive learning all about styling, photography & growing your passion into a business . We will be learning in the beautiful, light-filled @sfstudiosmith - a professional food styling & photography studio in the Nob Hill neighborhood of SF. Celebrating the bounty of summer produce, Chef Matt @bitesonbytes will be preparing the most amazing vegetarian & gluten-free menu and our event assistant Elena @alenka007 will be there helping to curate the most amazing experience for our attendees! . Soft launch of a new series: Self-Care Strategies! In these crazy times, I am kinda obsessed with self-care, mostly because I see how easy it is to let it go, and how awesome it is when I incorporate these little rituals into my life. In the coming months I'm excited to share some of the rituals that my favorite people incorporate into their daily routines and rituals. Starting with this Citrus Refresher, which is one of my fave ways to drink fire cider! in bio + http://bit.ly/2pc48BD
Day 6 of : Sword Fern. I love the opportunity to dig deeper into all the new-to-me plants in my newish habitat. These hardy, slightly battered fronds made it through the winter
Day 5 of : Citrus' last hurrah! The aftermath of the end of citrus season. Still so much grey & rain here, and citrus brings some cheer (I'm a few days behind, blame food poisoning!)

Day 4 of : Usnea. Not truly a plant, usnea is a lichen. With today's wind storm, it's strewn everywhere in the woods where I live. Usnea is considered an immune tonic and I'm excited to make my own tonic with it this spring. I love exploring my new neighborhood and ecosystem, especially now that plants are emerging from their winter slumbers

Wild and woolly early fall weather on Two Medicine Lake. I cold-brewed coffee, especially during a summer heatwave! Experimenting with @gevaliakaffe's robust House Blend, here's my super informal recipe: 1/2 cup ground coffee in 16-ounce mason jar, fill to brim with water, cover and set on counter overnight. Strain through a cone filter, add ice + milk of choice and you're set

CALL FOR SUBJECTS! This year I have been diving deep into Women's Work, a series of photo essays exploring and celebrating the many things that this phrase means. I decided this year to make a work resolution in addition to, and distinct from, personal resolutions. It's an intention and a focus as much as anything: clarity. On top of being rich and rewarding and creatively gratifying, diving into freelance photography has also been sometimes murky and muddy, and I haven't spent much time untangling that. So that's my north star for work this year. Here's to everything that clarity implies to ring in the new year.

Outtakes from Cambodia: in the dry season, so many shades of red, from the red clay earth that sifted onto any available surface to the deeply ruddy color of the sky in the mornings and evenings from trash fires and fires in the rice fields. What a place.

I love returning to familiar rituals after being away: my favorite coffee, San Francisco's glorious fog, an exploding garden, and spending a Saturday morning luxuriating in every page of @taraobrady's exquisite book. It is beyond amazing.
Such an amazing two weeks exploring Cambodia and Vietnam. Both so dynamic and vibrant. Not quite ready to leave. Thank you for sending me, @viking_cruises.

We went to a place where they showed how they make tons of amazing Vietnamese sweets, including puffed rice candies, coconut milk caramels (with durian! and other things), and paper-thin crunchy rice crisps. Sooooo yummy.
Today is the 40th anniversary of Vietnam's reunification. We're not allowed outside of our hotel until it's over.
Love this banana (semi) gradient
Rose Apple, perhaps the prettiest of all fruit. From the market in Sa Dec
Back in Vietnam, exploring the canals of the Mekong Delta, and a tour of a small farming and fishing village on Evergreen Island. Every day is amazing

It was fascinating to watch people fishing right off the side of our big boat. The Mekong is such a crazy confluence of the old and the new. They used plastic water bottles as floats. And pulled an empty net three times in a row. Not an easy life
Can't get enough fruit

It's a Friday night in Phnom Penh, that wild feeling where the heavy humid heat won't break and a break needs to happen. An awesome group of baby boomers partying on the top deck. Marveling at the magnitude and breadth of humanity. Life along the Mekong
Yesterday we were lucky enough to tour one of the traditional Khmer (Cambodian) homes in a small village. No running water, no electricity. Loved this kitchen moment especially
Dawn on the Mekong River, lots of boats along the water, fishing.
Traditional Cambodian houses built on stilts, not only for seasonal flooding but to circulate air to keep the homes cooler. Families spend their time underneath the house during the day

Move over sourdough, theres a new baked good in this kitchen. Im not sure Ive ever felt as accomplished as when I pulled these beauties out of the oven. Now the question is, do I buy new pants or stop making croissants? I followed the recipe in the @tartinebakery book. You can pickle that! Vegetables looking a little grim in your fridge? You can pickle that! Im planning a picnic spread so I took to the fridge to find a few vegetables lingering in there to pickle. These are sliced raw then covered in a hot bribe of distilled vinegar, dried dill, mustard seed, clove, pink peppercorns, salt, sugar and water. Bring to a boil then pour over your vegetables (or whatever else you may want to pickle - see @itsportlandia You Can Pickle That! sketch for reference

Our oldest turned 14 yesterday and for some reason I cant wrap my head around it. Maybe its because now I really feel that our time with him is really fleeting and that has me gasping for air and intention. I wrote the below in my journal leading up to his day. Its what I hope for each of my children and all of us really. There is so much yet to teach but I also know that there is not greater teacher than life itself. The biggest thing I want him to know is to trust himself. He is wise, smart, considerate and tuned in. I also want him to know that he has the skills and abilities to be successful in whatever he chooses but he has to believe that himself. He has to recognize that without anyone else giving it to him he has the permission to be here. To take up space. To ask for what he wants. To peruse big dreams. To make them a reality. This is his peanut butter Rice Krispie treat cake that he asks for every year. The recipe is in Lets Stay In

Get your leeks ready! Tomorrow (Sunday) Ill be going live to show you how to make my Bacon Leek Tart from Date Night In. This live demo is part of a weekend long pastry party put together by the beautiful souls from @thepastryproject_ Its called @apastryparty and together with some of my local friends and baking heros we are baking in support of local bakeries and dessert businesses affected by Covid-19. Check out all the amazing demos happening this weekend and be sure to follow @apastryparty. Check out their @GoFundMe for how you can support. Its a hard time for so many so if you cant give please consider sharing our pastry party with your friends. Thanks friends. Now here is the recipe so you can bake along with me tomorrow at 5:00 pm PST. https://www.gofundme.com/f/apastryparty Crust 1 cup/140 g unbleached all-purpose flour 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cubed and chilled 3 ounces Parmesan, freshly grated (about 3/4 cup packed) Custard 1 cup/227 g ricotta 1 egg 2 garlic cloves, minced 1 teaspoon chopped thyme leaves 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt 2 ounces freshly grated parmesan (1/2 cup) Pinch freshly ground nutmeg 4 slices regular cut bacon, roughly chopped 1 large or 2 small leeks, sliced 1/8-inch thick, white and light green parts only 1 tablespoon chopped chives Full directions in my stories

Thanks to the inspiration and guidance of @tanya.val, Ivy and I have had so much fun exploring the world of natural ink making. We looked around our kitchen and garden to see what we could find to make paint and I am so thrilled with the colors we created. We used coffee grounds, onion skin, passion tea, and butterfly pea flowers to get these greens, blues, grays and yellows (check out the color wheel on the next photo). Im getting used to the low-level anxiety Im constantly feeling. Im not always aware of it but I feel it. I get it. I know why its there. I dont like unknowns and all of this is an enormous unknown. I dont like to think about what will change or what well lose or how this will affect us financially ..... but its constantly there. All the unknowns and fears bundled in a grayness, ever present and giving me a constant dull ache. Its okay. I see you anxiety. I see you fear. I see you grief. Im not willing or wishing you away but I am going to cover you in gratitude and delight. I am going to focus on goodness and the constant beauty that surrounds me. Whether its the sun that never ceases to rise, the birds that continue in song or the smell of yeast waking up to make bread. I choose to spend more time washing myself in the waves of gratitude and beauty not to hide you or drown you out but maybe you too need some comfort. Feelings; all of you belong. We can all work together. Well get through this together

Tune in tomorrow (Tuesday) at 3:00 pm PST for our next kids cooking class. Were making Lemony Carbonara with Peas. Screenshot the recipe in my stories! Give your kids the phone, pour yourself a glass of wine and let me and my kids entertain them for a bit while they make you dinner

So it seems as though we parents have been thrown into the world of home schooling. Initially I started to panic now Im resolved to use this unique time to let the kids explore their curiosities and for each of us to finally get to those projects weve put off for when life slows down. I am also tapping into the gifts of my community to create a community school. We all have talents and gifts that can be used to help inspire and nurture these kids who have been forced to rethink school. Me? I can teach kids how to cook. So this week Ill be using this space as a cooking school for kids. At 3:00 pm PST hand your kids the phone so they can make you dinner. It will be live, unscripted and well well just wait and see what happens. But I hope we will all learn something. Today were making the Bahn Mi burgers from Lets Stay In. Ill post the ingredients and recipe in my stories. As we all know grocery stores on limited these days so there will be a lot of talk about substitutions. For example today well be using ground beef instead of pork. Wed love if you come join us

Checking in on all of you. How is everyone feeling? Ive had to practice some social media distancing in order to protect myself mentally. Lately though Ive been lifted by the humor found here and stories of light and hope in the midst of such uncertainty. I have to protect myself and my family but I also want to be a bringer of light, whatever that may look like in this situation. Food remains a constant place of comfort, sustenance and grace during this time. Im flooded with joy every time I can put a good meal on the table for my family. This lemony carbonara with peas is a family favorite. Get the recipe in this months @womansdaymag or in my book Lets Stay In. Be well and lets all practice radical kindness. Also, dont forget to laugh. It helps.

Let the dirty dishes of life remind you of the people who came to the table. . Maybe that makes sense, maybe it doesnt but its what is running through my mind as I look at my messy kitchen with a full heart. Ive started off the year being very intentional with using what we already have. Rather than rushing to the store to buy all the ingredients I need to make the dishes I crave Im looking in the pantry and finding inspiration in the abundance that I already have. Sometimes that looks like rice and beans three days in a row and sometimes its freshly baked sourdough with a salted roasted white chocolate spread. Im not a huge fan of white chocolate but I had quite a bit leftover from our cookie mix business so I started digging through the internet to find white chocolate recipes I may actually love. This recipe and method comes from @foodandwine. White chocolate is slowly roasted at 250*F and stirred every 15 minutes. Im talking like 3 hours slow. All hope appears lost several times during the process as the white chocolate can clump and tighten. But press on and keep stirring. Taste and delight throughout the process. At the end of it all heavy cream is stirred in and then this chocolate jam of sorts slips deeply into the cracks and crags and freshly baked bread. The sour ferment of the bread cuts the sweetness of the spread and suddenly preventing waste and trying to trim the food budget makes you feel like the richest person alive

Lessons I learned while making beet pasta: 1.The gnarly, slightly softened forgotten beets lingering deep within the vegetable drawer can still become something beautiful. 2. My beet-loathing family will happily devour the tastes-like-dirt vegetable if its in the company of enough flour and Parmesan. 3. Turns out I can actually get a legit workout from kneading pasta. So much so that my abs are sore the next day. That could also be a lesson teaching me to workout more. 4. When I can focus on enjoying the process; mindfully turning humble ingredients into a nourishing meal for the people I love most and rolling each individual noodle in a way that connects me to a tradition of women that extends far before and after my lifetime then spending hours on a meal that is gone in minutes becomes a meditation. And a reminder that life is really lived in the process

I jumped into this water today. Not a glamorous or graceful dive but rather a teeth clenched, quick dunk that took my breath away. A baptism of sorts. A release of 2019 and a very brisk and intense hello to 2020. Before the plunge I sat in my new kayak and let the water lead. I sat there and silently asked God to show up. I looked at the clouds and saw God. I saw the divine in the birds and the water and the snow covered mountains and the trees. But I wanted more. God. I said. Wouldnt it be amazing if you showed up in a whale right now? I would surely really feel and see that. Five seconds later a large black body rose out of the water. My heart soared. But it was too small to be a whale. A porpoise?! A few more flips out of the water and I realized it was a seal. I laughed out loud while feeling so loved. Sometimes you ask for a whale and you get a seal yet in all of it God is there.
I see you. We like sugar. So heres to more of that and more truth, love, beauty and everything in between.

Babies are so sweet and squishy. Toddlers are constant entertainment. But these years, teen and in-between, this is the first season in my parenting life where I want to freeze time. Every moment feels like a gift I think because I truly see that they are fleeting. (And also because there arent diapers and they are in school most of the day). Mamas and papas of littles. Dont fret about enjoying every moment. So many are not enjoyable. But do take lots of pictures, videos and write about their daily activities, actions and words. These are worth more than gold. Baking with both my boys like this happens most often for photoshoots (truth). Perhaps more accurate right now would be an image of Roman trying with all his might (and patience) to teach me how to play magic. And me sitting behind Baron marveling at how fast he can move his fingers on his keyboard while playing Fortnite. But the smiles and love are 100% accurate. I love and like these little humans so very much. The world is better because they are a part of it. Its an honor to know them and to love them. This photo is from the current issue of @womansdaymag. We are making our favorite holiday cake; the cranberry date cake (aka cranberry sticky toffee pudding). Find the recipe in the latest issue or on their site. Im thrilled to bring you so many more recipes in the pages of @womansdaymag in 2020!! . Photo: @brookefitts.photo Prop styling: @lauren.michelle.day Hair and makeup: @louve_life . Happy Holidays from our whole crew

A sweet holiday getaway to @thecaptainwhidbey with my love to celebrate 16 years of marriage. A glorious accomplishment worthy of celebration. @radriguezinc

GIVEAWAY!! . Whats your favorite recipe in your book? . With Date Night In I couldnt give an answer but when asked this question regarding Lets Stay In I always say the umbricelli. . Each noodle is hand rolled the way you would make little play dough snakes and worms as a child. The process is long but meditative. You can not help but feel the energy of your love being rolled right into the simple flour and water dough. Why else would we do this? Why spend hours in preparation for something that will be gone in 15 minutes? . Because we love. Love our people. Love to gather. Love food. . The sauce is a simple connection of a few mighty but humble ingredients. When combined the flavor is earthy, rich and satisfying in a way that insists you sit back, close your eyes and cement these tastes to memory. Maybe thats the taste of love. Or sausage. . My lovely publishers have offered to send a copy of Lets Stay In to five of you wonderful people. Leave a comment, tag a friend, share this post and/or share a favorite recipe you love to make in your own kitchen and use the . They each get you an entry. . Ill pick five lucky winners Monday morning
